jobs.title: Web Application Developer (CTI)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Melbourne, Australia

Lovestock & Leaf is looking for a seasoned JavaScript & PHP developer to join our software development team to help us build and maintain business apps leveraging off the Zendesk Platform.

We’re looking for a person preferably full-time on contract for the next 3 months with the view to extending the engagement if all goes well.  

The ideal candidate will have experience in developing CTI apps for Cisco CUCM & UCCX utilising the Cisco Jabber Web SDK and associated Cisco API’s to work on further development of our Blower app for Zendesk (amongst other projects): https://www.zendesk.com/apps/blower-for-cisco/

Lovestock & Leaf is the No.1 Zendesk Implementation Partner and Apps Developer globally.  Our growing customer base for our apps and services includes Uber, Box, Motley Fool, Pivotal, Coursera, Groupon, Telstra & Fairfax Media to name a few.

This is a great opportunity for someone to join the team and be a key member of the growth phase of this company.  

We are based in Melbourne, Australia with a virtual office/coworking space in the city, but all of us work remotely the majority of the time, so your location is not an issue.

Position Description Overview

  • Designs, develops, modifies, documents, tests, implements, installs and supports software applications and systems for the business.
  • Passionate about programming and technologies, good user experience and understanding and solving customer requirements
  • Proven coding skills, with a focus on efficient and scalable code
  • Solid understanding in web infrastructure and web protocols
  • Expertise in Javascript/JQuery a must
  • Experience in developing CTI apps for Cisco CUCM and/or UCCX utilising the Cisco Jabber Web SDK and Cisco API’s is critical.
  • Comparative experience in CTI with another platform, such as Avaya or Genesys will also be considered. 
  • Node.js expertise or at least an eagerness to learn Node.js is a must
  • Minimum 3+ years experience of real world web development.
  • PHP and/or Node.js expertise a big advantage
  • A well known PHP framework under your belt is an advantage
  • Knowledge and experience working with Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions and the customisation and integration (using API’s) of these with other applications.
  • Understand moderately complex database concepts as well as the implications of different database designs.Experienced using a version control system such as Git, Subversion or Mercurial
  • Knowledgeable of client server and internet systems architectures.

A key function of this position will be to help advise and negotiate around the most appropriate platform and services to use for efficiently delivering the required functionality on projects. As such, teamwork, communication, lateral thinking and problem-solving skills are a must.

Primary Role and Responsibilities.

  • Develop moderately complex software in Javascript, PHP and Node.js for Zendesk and L&L proprietary products and/or applications consistently following coding standards and in accordance with applicable software development methodology and release processes.
  • Support, maintain and extend existing Zendesk apps built by L&L.
  • Work closely with the management team in evaluating current systems and making decisions on future development.
  • Utilise software engineering tools such as configuration management systems, build processes, and debuggers in the software development process and contributes to the ongoing enhancement of these processes/systems.
  • Create and execute solution designs for new functionality as part of software projects related to L&L’s products and services.
  • Provide solutions to a variety of problems using sound problem-solving techniques.
  • Document code consistently throughout the development process.
  • Perform technical root cause analysis and outline corrective action for given problems.
  • Estimate level of effort, evaluate new options of similar technology, offer suggestions to improve processes, and provide comments on some solution design aspects.
  • Enthusiastically exhibit a desire to see L&L succeed through a positive contribution to the company culture and tangible outcomes from work delivered.  

Salary negotiable based on experience, please send in your salary expectations along with your application.

To apply: jobs@lovestockleaf.com

jobs.title: Senior Kernel Engineer
jobs.content:
HyTrust is seeking an experienced kernel/driver Software Engineer to join the continued expansion of DataControl into AWS, Azure, KVM and OpenStack. The ideal candidate will combine expertise in server management, virtualization and security with drive and leadership to build a killer product.


 We’re delivering security technology that makes it possible for large corporations and government agencies to virtualize their data centers and expand into the cloud while keeping their operations and data secure. Our product suite provides encryption and key management capabilities for cloud-hosted virtual machines and data.


 Responsibilities:



  • Design and build core components that secure data and management of enterprise-scale servers operating across private and public clouds.

  • Deliver high-performance solutions by collaborating with your peers to hunt-down bottlenecks and optimize the performance and scalability essential for Cloud customers.

  • Research new technologies and techniques that help us innovate new ways to secure and operationalize the virtualized data center.

  • Accept the leadership responsibilities of your projects, offer support in the projects lead by others

  • Work independently and with a team, commit to delivery schedules, take ownership of both your contribution and to the overall success of the products and their use by HyTrust customers.

  • Be ready to assist all the other teams that make a fast-moving startup a success (Customer Support, Sales, Documentation, QA, Marketing, Partner and Business Development, etc.).

jobs.title: Senior Security Engineer, Cloud Security Products
jobs.content:
If you’re an experienced security engineer looking for an opportunity to influence the security of the largest commercial and government networks on the planet, consider joining HyTrust, a rapidly growing cloud security leader based in Mountain View, CA.


We’re delivering security technology that makes it possible for large corporations and government agencies to virtualize their data centers and expand into the cloud while keeping their operations and data secure. Our industry-leading technology is so essential that HyTrust is being funded by the biggest movers in computer infrastructure, including VMware, CISCO, Intel, and investors for the U.S. intelligence agencies. 


WHO ARE YOU?



  • You long ago mastered the essentials of networks and systems, and now focus on understanding the intricacies of security vulnerabilities and the ways to defend against their exploitation.

  • You know that security spans many elements in any computing environment and so are excited about collaborating with engineers across multiple disciplines.

  • You have a background in software development and so ground your security problem-solving with a solid understanding of programming and real-world system mechanics.

  • You’re looking for a small company because you want to own your job, set the direction, accomplish your goals, and work in a fast-paced agile environment.

  • You are the driving force behind building security into the fabric of a company’s solution and will be an integral part of what makes HyTrust products exceptional in the market.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop the strategy and design a suite of security challenges that HyTrust products must meet to satisfy the high-security needs of our Fortune 500 customers.

  • Conduct penetration testing and attack surface analysis.

  • Build security test suites with the goal of passing 3rd-party security audits and obtaining various security certifications.

  • Act as a researcher (and co-author) for security-focused publications further solidifying HyTrust’s stature as security industry experts.

  • Participate in code reviews with developers, helping them avoid and patch security related bugs.

  • Consult with the HyTrust product team on security-specific functions for future product releases.

  • Identify the hardware and software tools necessary to maintain a rigorous security testing regime.

jobs.title: Senior QA Engineer
jobs.content:
HyTrust is seeking a Senior QA Engineer to help improve the quality and performance of its award-winning flagship product, HyTrust CloudControl. The ideal candidate will combine hands-on experience on one or more virtualization platforms, an understanding of the ecosystem in large customer environments, and an instinct for uncovering quality, usability and performance issues.


The HyTrust product suite provides control and visibility for virtualized infrastructures as well as encryption and key management capabilities for cloud-hosted virtual machines and data.


What you will do:



  • Learn - Develop a deep understanding of the product and its usage by our customers.

  • Develop - Develop and document test plans and test cases; Develop and enhance automated tests.

  •  Test - Install and configure HyTrust and other products on a variety of virtualization platforms (VMWare, OpenStack, …); Regularly execute tests and record results during release cycles.

  •  Collaborate - Work with development engineers to drive issues to resolution and closure; Work with the field support organization to investigate customer escalations. Perform root-cause analysis of problems and isolate issues.

  •  Create – a culture of zero-tolerance for buggy software delivery.

  •  Evangelize - Actively participate in discovery and design phases of new feature development and advocate for continuous testing and incremental integration to make it right first and keep it right while you make it better.

jobs.title: Senior UI Engineer
jobs.content:
HyTrust is seeking a senior User Interface engineer to help us realize our vision of providing the best customer experience across two of our flagship products. If you are passionate about working on user interfaces, familiar with modern UI frameworks and are ready to take on the challenge to overhaul, upgrade and unify our UI technology stack across our product portfolio, come talk to us.


You will be working as part of a small tightly knit team  charged with upgrading our UI stack from a template-based, server-side, html generation framework, to a client-side Javascript-based, single page application, paving the way for dynamic interactions, and enforcing a strict separation between the GUI and back-end.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Mavrx uses aerial imagery collected by our network of planes, satellites and UAVs, and big data to enable the global agriculture industry and farmers to manage their crops more efficiently.


This position for an Embedded Systems Software / Firmware Engineer (Full-Time) would see you joining our fast-moving team based in San Francisco that spans a wide gamut of skills and experiences, from engineers building our latest generation of aerial imaging hardware; to developers building out scalable image and data processing pipelines; to specialists in agronomy, satellite data processing, and data science; all working together to tackle the real-world problem of helping farmers do more with less in an increasingly difficult climate.


Tasks You'll Be Responsible For



  • Develop the embedded firmware for our new airborne camera based on Xilinx Zynq 7020 hardware platform, and ARM-based SBC storing images to non-volatile storage, which will be deployed across our nation-wide imaging network.

  • Implement algorithms developed by the image processing team into this camera platform.

  • Co-Develop the firmware/software that drives our nation-wide upload infrastructure, which handles terabytes of image data daily;

  • Investigate new and novel image acquisition and processing techniques to increase the efficiency of our image gathering program.

  • Be a key contributor to the small team who determine the future of our image acquisition platform.

jobs.title: Sr. Front-end Engineer
jobs.content:
Sr. Front-end Engineer


At Railroad19, we develop customized software solutions and provide software development services.  We are currently seeking a talented Sr. Front-end Engineer to join our world-class team of developers assigned to work on various project teams at our Enterprise client. This role will be responsible for contributing to the design, development, and implementation of front-end solutions for our client. In addition to contributing code and tangible deliverables the role is expected to work as an advisor to help identify, educate, and foster best-in-class solutions. The role requires the applicant to create and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and team members. Creating these relationships requires strong communication skills and some travel.


As a Railroad19 employee, you will be part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. Our headquarters is located in Saratoga Springs, New York, but this position is remote, however, there is an expectation to travel to the client site in NYC at a few times per month. Therefore, for ease and quickness of commute, we would prefer individuals who live near the tristate area or near our corporate office in the Saratoga/Albany, NY area. Railroad19 provides competitive compensation and excellent benefits.



Core Responsibilities



  • Foster strong relationships with key stakeholders and provide expertise as well as customer service to meet a wide variety of requirements

  • Quickly provide insight and options to front-end challenges

  • Collaborate with Product Managers and business teams to create consumer-like, elegant, intuitive experience for enterprise users

  • Contribute both technically and in an advisory role to projects

  • Develop and manage extensible, stable code bases for a variety of applications

  • Provide front-end architecture and esthetic thought leadership

  • Stay current with the fast changing landscape of browser based application development

  • Evaluate frameworks, technology, platforms and tooling solutions

  • Support and troubleshoot issues (process & system), identify root cause, and proactively implement sustainable corrective actions

jobs.title: Sr. Cloud Platform Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Sr. Cloud Platform Systems Engineer 


Due to growth, we are looking for a successful candidate with a Cloud & Systems Engineering background, experience in PaaS and software development.  This role is 100% remote working with other remote employees.


You will be consulting with other technology teams to resolve technical issues for managed software and application integration. You must have proven experience with PaaS/web-infrastructure on open-source platforms. The position is hands on and you will be required to work with developers to establish best practices. You will also work with solutions architects on evolving business requirements while strengthening the tech stack at a large Fortune 100 Media Company.


At Railroad19, you will be part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. Our headquarters is located in Saratoga Springs, New York, but this position gives you the ability to work remote. Railroad19 provides competitive compensation and excellent benefits.


Responsibilities



  • Support and enhance business-critical PaaS/Web infrastructure for corporate environments

  • Install, configure, integrate, deploy, upgrade, and manage web infrastructure, including but not limited to the following environments: LAMP, Cloud Foundry, and Java EE containers

  • Research and recommend emerging technologies in partnership with Solutions Architects to meet evolving business requirements

  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues for managed software and aid in application integration for PaaS solutions running on VMWare

  • Identify opportunities and create scripts for automating deployments and recurring tasks

  • Act as a liaison with solution providers on technical issues and updates

  • Create and document technical processes for use by L1&L2 support teams

  • Interact and communicate with all levels of an organization including different service delivery partners

jobs.title: Cloud Native Java Developer
jobs.content:
Railroad19 Inc. is a company that provides software development as a service.


We are currently seeking a Cloud Native Java Developer that is fluent in both Spring Boot and Java 8 to be a technical resource for the development of clean and maintainable code.


At Railroad19, you are part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. While our headquarters are located in Saratoga Springs, New York, we are a distributed team of remote developers across the US.


Railroad19 provides competitive compensation and excellent benefits.


Core responsibilities:



  • Understand our client's fast-moving business requirements

  • Negotiate appropriate solutions with multiple stake-holders

  • Write and maintain scalable enterprise quality software

  • Build web applications using AngularJS and Spring Boot

  • Build Microservices that connect to Oracle and NoSQL databases

  • Manage the complete software development lifecycle

  • Writing functional and unit tests in order to maintain code quality

  • Work with Jenkins to perform continuous integration

  • Collaborate with other teams in order to deliver a highly performant application that contains little or no defects

  • Identify new opportunities, tools, and services to enhance the custom software platform

  • Support and troubleshoot issues (process & system), identify root cause, and proactively recommend sustainable corrective actions

jobs.title: Software Development Manager
jobs.content:
Leepfrog Technologies’ CourseLeaf Software is used by over 200 of the nation’s most academically complex universities to manage their online academic catalogs and curriculum processes.



The Software Development Manager is responsible for supervising the software development staff. This includes collaborating with the implementation and support managers to balance core development priorities with operational priorities. This person will coordinate with our software architect to ensure key decisions are propagating throughout the development teams and the product lines appropriately. They will also oversee and modify as needed our core development processes to ensure high standard consistency.



Duties:



  • Coordinate weekly priorities for developers and monitor the execution of assignments. Priorities are a mix of the following:

    • Implementation of new clients

    • Support of existing clients

    • Roadmap items for product improvements

    • New product development



  • Manage communication as priorities or timelines need to change on a day to day basis.

  • Establish a training and/or mentorship program for new/junior software developers.

  • Understand the design and overall software architecture of our product suite.

  • Identify standard software patterns and coding styles for developers to use when writing code.

  • Establish a robust code review process.

  • Manage and reorganize the structure of the development teams as needed.

  • Give technical feedback to technical and non-technical business professionals alike.

  • Stay current about industry developments.

  • Integrate the development work with other department managers to ensure consistencies.

  • Write reports and documentation as needed.

  • Supervise, motivate, and delegate tasks to each team of software developers. This includes:

    • Resolving employee issues and acting as the employees’ advocate.

    • Participate in short and long term planning for the development teams.



  • Other tasks as needed.

jobs.title: JavaScript Developer
jobs.content:
Leepfrog Technologies' CourseLeaf software is used by over two hundred of the nation's most academically complex universities to manage their online academic catalogs and curriculum processes.


The JavaScript Developer is primarily responsible for designing, customizing, coding, testing, and implementing client websites in support of the CourseLeaf system.  A successful candidate should be capable of full cycle project leadership including site layout/user interface, database design/programming, and development.  Developers are obliged to be quality, detail, and results oriented.  A combination of overall technologist, a passion for testing, and interpersonal skills is desired and will frequently garner the greatest rewards. 


Duties:



  • Coordinate/work closely with Project Managers and other members of the Development Team to ensure timely completion of deliverables.

  • Manage project tasks, timelines, and communication.

  • Design and creation of relational database schemas.

  • Routine daily maintenance of existing sites and applications.

    • Fix software issues and code irregularities.

    • Perform code maintenance, testing, and analysis.

    • Implement software or product enhancements.

    • Give technical feedback to non-technical business professionals.

    • Design and complete project assignments.

    • Stay current about industry developments.

    • Write reports and documentation as needed.

    • Other tasks as needed for successful project completion.

jobs.title: Salesforce Developer
jobs.content:
We are currently seeking a Salesforce Developer to design, code, implement, and deploy our enterprise Salesforce environment.  The ideal candidate will have experience developing with enterprise Salesforce environments and working with various teams across the company in making their dreams a reality.  This position can either be based at the Wowza corporate headquarters near Golden Colorado, or from your own home remote location (preference to Mountain and Pacific time zones)


 Accountabilities



  • Building functionality into Salesforce that is beyond basic administration – APEX classes, Triggers, Visualforce, etc.

  • Integrating Salesforce data with other third-party applications such as HubSpot, Zuora, Zendesk, and internal applications

  • Attending daily stand-up meetings ready to discuss story progress

  • Working with Web Developers in implementing customer store and portal features

  • Interfacing with other teams (Sales, Marketing, Billing, Engineering, Business Technology) to determine upcoming needs for Salesforce

jobs.title: Staff Software R&D Engineer
jobs.content: Responsible for designing, developing, and debugging software programs for modeling IC fabrication processes. This role involves maintaining existing code, research on emerging technologies, and developing new solutions. It requires working with customers to understand new requirements at the early, exploratory stage, as well as disseminating modeling expertise to Synopsys field support engineers to enable them to adapt modeling solutions to customer-specific requirements.

jobs.title: R&D Engineer
jobs.content:
Responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, or debugging software programs. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases and internet-related tools, etc. Determines hardware compatibility and/or influences hardware design.


Experience in programming software for operating systems, utilizing machine assembly and/or job control languages, and some knowledge of software capabilities. Designs algorithms and data structures. Experience on development of complex software projects, familiarity with C/C++ coding, and a strong background in data structures and algorithms. Has strong desires to learn and explore new technologies and demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills. Prior knowledge and experience of CAD tool development are required.

jobs.title: R&D Engineer, Sr. Staff
jobs.content: The Sr. Staff R&D Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, or debugging software programs. He / She Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases and internet-related tools, etc. Determines hardware compatibility and/or influences hardware design. Develops software tools using C/C++ for solving problems in IC implementation and optimization flow. The candidate will be part of new generation Place and Route R&D team and responsible for designing and developing timing optimization engine for hierarchical designs and top level closure.

jobs.title: Senior R&D Engineer
jobs.content:
HAPS is Synopsys' industry leading FPGA-based prototyping system, providing state of the art hardware and cutting edge software to deliver the best-in-class integrated prototyping solution. See more details at :


https://www.synopsys.com/PROTOTYPING/FPGABASEDPROTOTYPING

This position allows the candidate to deliver cornerstone technologies and capabilities in auto partitioning. Main responsibilities include:



  • Optimizing/improving HAPS system partition quality of results by developing complex and innovative partition and routing algorithms

  • Building partition support infrastructure in areas such as data structures; timing analysis; routing and time domain multiplexing; hardware modeling

jobs.title: Sr. Product Security Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Sr. Product Security Engineer with the Synopsys (SIG) Software Security Group, you have the opportunity to assess the security of the products developed by the R&D team. This is a critical position within the business unit, which develops industry-leading tools meant to assess both the quality and security of enterprise software.
 
As Synopsys becomes a major player in the Software Security industry with its acquisition of Coverity and Codenomicon, the security of our own applications is mission critical. In this role, you will work cross-business, from different groups within R&D, and collaborate with the Security Research Lab (SRL).
 
You will be responsible for:
 
 



  • Define and perform secure code reviews and penetration tests across a wide variety of products

  • Contribute to threat modeling and architecture risk analysis activities

  • Interact directly with development teams to help them understand and mitigate security issues

  • Collaborat with the Security Research Lab to define other ways to detect security issues

  • Define and contribute to the security excellence of Synopsys SIG development practices

jobs.title: coffeescript craftsman needed for enhancing meteor medical app
jobs.content: This particular project uses CoffeeScript and the base Meteor packages (Blaze). You'll need to know how to get things done in that environment.

jobs.title: Magento Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Denver, CO
URL: http://branchlabs.com

Your Day-to-day
This is a hands-on, contract programming position. You'll be working on eCommerce platforms and CMSes like Magento, Shopify and WordPress. The core technologies you'll be working with are PHP, HTML, CSS, and JS. Our projects are generally focused around making large, material changes to our clients' sites or designing and developing new sites from the ground up.

We have quite a bit of work lined up in the next few months, so an ideal applicant will be ready to hit the ground running. Despite the amount of work we have, I strive to minimize context switching—if you're on a project, you shouldn't expect to be bombarded with unrelated tweaks on other projects here and there.

About BranchLabs
BranchLabs is a small eCommerce consultancy based in the LoHi neighborhood of Denver, CO.

Our reputation is built on delivering results. We take pride in the work we produce. The products we deliver are high quality inside and out, and they help our clients capitalize on real opportunities. We work closely with founders and stakeholders, combining their understanding of their business with our understanding of all things eCommerce. Together, we craft solutions that work for our clients and their customers.

Technical Responsibilities
When you start, this is what you can expect to work on.

  • Full Magento site development
  • Design architecture, then implement features for existing Magento stores
  • Implement designs in CSS/HTML/JS
  • Configure Magento-related middleware services, Redis, Memcached, Varnish, Solr, etc.
  • Integrate with 3rd party APIs

Qualifications
These are the must haves. Basically: be a web developer!

  • Proficient in HTML, CSS, and JS
  • Hands-on programming experience with Magento
  • Object Oriented PHP experience
  • Git experience
  • Understand the web—REST, HTTP verbs, basic HTTP status codes, etc.
  • Familiarity with the Unix command line

Ideal Qualifications
If you fulfill the above and have experience with a few of the below, definitely get in touch.

  • 3–5+ years of industry experience
  • Hands-on programming experience with Shopify
  • Enterprise software development
  • Strong UX/UI chops
  • Experience setting up and configuring Apache
  • Opinionated about design—visual and code
  • A portfolio of personal projects (not necessarily code related)

Some Notes on Culture
Here are some of our values. They're always being refined based on what works and what doesn't.

  • We value clear, concise communication.
  • Quality can only be discerned in the context of an objective.
  • Provide context and motivation for each task to empower developers to find better solutions.
  • Automate repeatable processes to free up time for interesting problems.
  • No process for process' sake. No meetings for meetings' sake.
  • Build or use tools to provide predictability and eliminate boring work.
  • Programmer productivity is hugely dependent on a minimally distracting, supportive environment.

Benefits
As a small company, we have a lot of freedom to offer flexible benefits. It all depends on what's important to you. Here are a few though...

  • Flexible hours
  • Ability to have enormous impact, both on BranchLabs and on our clients
  • Objectively measurable impact (client's eCommerce revenue, conversion rates, etc.)

To apply: Email a cover letter and a resume to graham+wwr@branchlabs.com. If it looks good, I'll be in touch. Looking forward to hearing from you!

jobs.title: Marketing Designer
jobs.content: Snap Inc. is hiring a Marketing Designer in Los Angeles, CA

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
New Context is looking to hire a Lead Software Engineer who is both capable of writing code and steering a team of like-minded innovative developers. You will need to be comfortable interfacing with various software components and always considering how best to deliver in a rapidly iterative fashion with a strong focus on service availability, scalability and resilience.


Your Role


Your role as a lead software engineer is to lead a team of engineers who collaboratively develop applications and infrastructure. You will be responsible for ensuring the team is staying on task and working towards building product which meets the customer’s business goals. As a lead, you will own the development process and interface with engineers and customers on a daily basis. Candidates should be well versed in the Agile development methodology. This position has the opportunity to have direct technical reports within the organizational structure.

jobs.title: Freelance DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
When it comes to modern day software development, you will have your finger on the pulse of the entire pipeline. You will need to be comfortable interfacing with various software components and always considering how best to deliver in a rapidly iterative fashion with a strong focus on service availability, scalability and resilience.


DevOps is as much about communication and business relationships as it is about any of the software or tools you will use.


About Us


New Context is a rapidly growing consulting company in the heart of downtown San Francisco. We specialize in Lean Security; an approach that leads organizations to build better software thru hands-on technical and management consulting. We are a group of engineers who live and breath Agile Infrastructure, Systems Automation, Cloud Orchestration, and Information Security.


The New Context team personifies the DevOps spirit. We love a challenge and look forward to working with clients to solve their own challenges. Our teams operate with complete stack awareness of infrastructure, application and security.


Our driving methodologies are Lean Security and Humane Systems. In adopting a security first approach to infrastructure focused on people, processes and technologies, our team will have an integral part in driving the direction of these exciting new approaches.

jobs.title: Full Stack Java Engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking for full-stack engineers that want to join a passionate and talented team.  We're using a modern stack (more below).


Our ideal candidate is someone that:



  • is addicted to tech, stays abreast of trends, tools

  • programs in their free time  

  • is pragmatic: knows how to blend bleeding edge with established tech

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
What We’re Looking For


We have an opportunity for a Java Developer to join our team. This is a challenging and rewarding role that involves creating, maintaining, and improving software solutions to support our business strategies. Our developers work collaboratively with every department within Apex to improve the user experience, and make recommendations on technology changes.


Opportunity to Excel


Our developers significantly enhance our user experience, both internally and externally. They ensure that Apex has seamless processes in all areas of the business, and that clients are able to access their information with ease.
Our most successful developers enjoy working in a team environment, challenging each other on a daily basis. They love working with our user groups to determine ways to improve our current system or create entirely new applications. Our developers understand that their ability to create a legendary user experience regularly takes our business to new heights. If you’re a Java developer who loves to be involved in all parts of the development process and has database experience, this may be the job for you!

jobs.title: Lead Frontend Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: San Francisco
URL: www.konsus.com

Role

  • Directly reporting to CTO working on all frontend appplications (customer facing as well as internal ops applicatoins)
  • Be a part of highly paced team that push the code to production every week, instead of waiting months!
  • Be part of of fast growing YC startup with international client base, strong growth record and a great team
  • Competive comp, stock options and benefits
  • Work remote - whenever and from wherever you want

Your responsibility:
  • Own the delivery of the frontend development pipeline
  • Develop data and business layers for the frontend, and integrate with our backend-server.
  • Develop complex user interfaces for the web-based applications
  • Evaluate and recommend new technology and tools
  • Improve SEO and overall site performance
  • Develop a highly modular system that embodies the seperation of concern principle
 

Requirements:

  • 5yrs + experience
  • Produce quick AND robust output
  • javascript/typescript skills
  • Knowledge in Node.js
  • Experience with Single-page-apps, preferable React
  • Experience with OOP
 

About Konsus:
  • We are a fast-growing San Francisco-based startup, with solid funding from highly reputable Silicon Valley-investors
  • Our mission is to shape the future of how business and work is done around a new and connected globe.
  • Konsus provides on-demand business support. Companies around the world send us office tasks and we instantly assign them to pre-vetted freelancers based on skill and availability. This allows companies to free up time and save money, while getting more done.
  • We already have 500+ customers with some very large international clients and are growing strongly
 
Software-stack:

Frontend-stack (Language: Typescript)
  • Node.js
  • React.js (+isomorphic app for max performance)
  • Elastic beanstalk (auto-scalable servers for performance)

Backend-stack (Language: java)
  • Spring boot
  • Hibernate + Mysql 5.7
  • jUnit for testing
  • Elastic beanstalk (auto-scalable servers for performance)

Integrations:
  • Mixpanel, google analytics (for tracking)
  • Google adwords, twitter pixel, facebook pixel (for ad tracking and retargeting)
  • Freshbooks (for invoices)
  • Braintree (for payments)
  • Sendgrid (for email services)
  • Intercom (for messaging)
  • Bamboo (Continous developing)

To apply: Please apply directly -> https://konsus.interviewed.com/jobs/lead-frontend-software-en-pzgv

jobs.title: Performance Test Engineer
jobs.content: As a QA Engineer – Performance Specialist, you will be responsible for the creation, maintenance, and execution of performance-related tests.  Scope of responsibility encompasses all systems supporting the E-commerce websites across banners, including internal projects.

jobs.title: User Interface Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thrive Bioscience is building the machines that make stem cells. As scientists get closer to using stem cells in humans, there is an ever increasing need to automate the process of making, modifying and growing stem cells. Thrive's mission is to deliver that automation.


Thrive's instruments involve robotics, image processing, fluid handling, refrigeration / heating and centrifugation. These are complicated devices that manipulate living cells. All of this is controlled from a web browser using modern web technologies like HTML5, React/Redux, and Electron.


Thrive's founders, management and board each have decades of experience building and growing successful, technologically innovative companies. We work with world-class scientists at leading institutions to develop the instruments and software they need to push their research forward.


We are looking for an experienced web user interface software developer to join our engineering team. You will help us build these innovative robotic cell culture systems, own multiple activities across the product lifecycle, and collaborate closely with the entire cross discipline team at Thrive.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thrive Bioscience is building the machines that make stem cells. As scientists get closer to using stem cells in humans, there is an ever increasing need to automate the process of making, modifying and growing stem cells. Thrive's mission is to deliver that automation.


Thrive's instruments involve robotics, image processing, fluid handling, refrigeration / heating and centrifugation. These are complicated devices that manipulate living cells.


Thrive's founders, management and board each have decades of experience building and growing successful, technologically innovative companies. We work with world-class scientists at leading institutions to develop the instruments and software they need to push their research forward.


We are looking for an experienced embedded software developer to join our engineering team. You will be part of a team that is integrating a wide range of technologies including robotics, distributed processing, user interface, fluidics, environmental control, microscopy, machine learning and image processing to develop an expanding family of instruments.

jobs.title: Architect
jobs.content:
SeatAdvisor, a proven innovator delivering a smarter ticketing and patron management solution for venues worldwide, is seeking a Software Architect.  If you consider yourself highly motivated, entrepreneurial, hands on, and are interested in working on a platform used by millions to buy tickets for events they care about, we’d love to hear from you.


Your role…



  • Collaborate with engineers, product managers, designers, and customers to design and implement a smarter ticketing platform for performing arts and sports organizations.

  • Clearly distill product requirements and define project boundaries in order to maximize concurrent development

  • Identify and build tools for managing cloud infrastructure, deploying and scaling applications, and ensuring a secure computing environment

  • Research, profile, and optimize platform components to deliver highly available, reliable, scalable, and performant software solutions 


Who we think will be a great fit…



  • You’re willing to have fun, can handle challenging situations with a sense of humor, but more important, you have a passion for being part of an exciting, dynamic company based in beautiful San Diego.

  • Strong written and verbal skills to be able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical team members

  • Able to balance product, engineering, and overall business requirements to offer solutions that are well thought out and articulate

  • You’re willing to invest in our customers and develop deep empathy for their needs, able to distill insights into the right solution

  • Enjoys mentoring fellow engineers in order to succeed as a team rather just as an individual

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Software Engineer in DevOps to support and maintain the core components of our financial platform and scale it to serve millions of users across the world. The technical scope of the project is broad and leverages a variety of cutting-edge commercial and open source tools to get the job done.


Responsibilities: 



  • You will help drive all application-level aspects of the company’s SaaS operations

  • You will build, deploy, analyze, troubleshoot and scale the service wherever and whenever

  • You will collaborate closely with Engineering and Data Scientists on all architectural decisions and stay current on nascent technologies to make influential recommendations

  • You will operate very large relational and NoSQL databases, queuing systems, pub-sub servers, and other core infrastructural components

jobs.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Senior Backend Developer to design and implement core components of our financial platform and scale it to serve millions of users across the world. The technical scope of the project is broad and calls for technical expertise across a wide range of problem domains.


THE ROLE:



  • You will design and implement product features as defined in the roadmap

  • You will own and maintain substantial portions of the backend infrastructure

  • The opportunity to code using cutting-edge platforms and interact with our data science team

  • You will mentor and grow junior engineers on best practices and code efficiency

jobs.title: Senior Software Architect
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a Software Architect to architect and implement core components of our platform and scale it to serve millions of users across the world. The technical scope of the project is broad and calls for technical expertise across a wide range of problem domains.


THE ROLE:



  • You will architect and implement substantial portions of the full-stack infrastructure (both frontend and backend)

  • You will tackle scalability challenges as the infrastructure grows to support increasing user base

  • You will mentor and grow junior engineers on best practices and code efficiency

  • The opportunity to code using cutting-edge platforms and interact with our data science team


QUALIFICATIONS:




    • Technical Leader - you love new technology and always strive for the most fundamentally sound architecture and solution

    • Detailed oriented - you are a proven developer who values clean and efficient code, and always go into the weeds to find the root cause of problems

    • Translator - you have experience working closely with product managers, cross-functional teams, and customers to translate requirements into technical design

    • Solutions Driven - you have experience thinking out loud to create the best solutions to complex, tricky problems, using the latest technical methodologies/processes

    • Craftsmanship - you treat software development as a professional craft and constantly practice your skills

jobs.title: Senior Architect - Rated #1 on Glassdoor
jobs.content:
Choose Credera for a rewarding career that provides a range of opportunities and challenges that allow you to play a key role in solving problems for top Fortune 500 companies…a place where you will have the chance to work with cutting edge technologies alongside the brightest technical minds in the industry. Choose Credera for the chance to work with leaders who desire to equip and encourage you both in your personal and professional growth through monthly tech meetings and a company-wide mentorship program...choose Credera for the chance to work in a fun environment where you would enjoy minimal travel, company Fireside Chats, monthly happy hours, and a company trip!


Credera is proud to have tied in rating with the #1 company on Glassdoor’s Best Place to Work list, received their OpenCompany Distinction, and to have a 100% employee recommendation rating. We are also honored to be selected as one of Texas Monthly Magazine’s Best Companies to Work for in Texas (2013, 2014, 2015, 2016), one of the Inc. 5000 Fastest Growing Private Companies in America (2012, 2013, 2014, 2015), and The Dallas Morning News’ Top 100 Places to Work (2011, 2012, 2015).


Those selected for this position will join a high performing team of individuals who endeavor to live out our core values of humility, integrity, excellence, and professionalism.  If you would like to be associated with a rapidly growing firm that passionately believes in providing excellent client service, then please consider joining our professional family.


As a member of Credera’s Technical Architecture and Strategy Practice, you will work directly with our clients to solve their toughest business and technology challenges. We seek passionate technologists who possess deep industry and consulting experience to provide project architecture and technical leadership on client engagements. You will contribute to our clients’ fundamental software strategies by matching business needs with the right technology, making strategic technical recommendations and presenting to them client executive leadership. In addition, you will also design and build world class software, test and implement solutions that meet project objectives and timelines. Typical engagements include, but are not limited to, Custom Application Development to Enterprise Portal Design and Implementation, eCommerce (i.e., B2B and B2C), Mobile Solutions, Enterprise Application Integration.

jobs.title: Full Stack Java Architect - Rated #1 on Glassdoor
jobs.content:
If you would like to be associated with a rapidly growing company that passionately believes in providing excellent client service, then please consider joining our professional family. Those selected for this position will join a high performing team of individuals who endeavor to live out our core values of humility, integrity, excellence, and professionalism.


Credera is proud to have tied in rating with the #1 company on Glassdoor’s Best Place to Work list, received their OpenCompany Distinction, and to have a 100% employee recommendation rating.


As a Full Stack Java Architect at Credera you’ll:



  • Design and implement complete solution from a proof of concept to a robust high-volume production application

  • Develop prototypes quickly

  • Estimate level of effort and complexity

  • Lead development teams using an iterative methodology

  • Perform peer code reviews

  • Learn new technologies as needed


Why you should join our team:



  • Keep your skills fresh by working with some of the newest languages and frameworks out there

  • Accelerate your career with more variety, a faster pace, and clear and achievable career advancement (recognition, salary and bonus rewards available along the way!)

  • Enjoy a transparent, collaborative, friendly and fun culture. 


We expect humility, integrity, collaboration from everyone who works at Credera, which includes taking ownership of mistakes made and looking to share credit for a job well done.  Our culture is one in which you can voice your ideas with peers and leaders on technical and non-technical subjects, and expect open and honest discussion and consideration.  Your talent and strengths will be valued over a one-size-fits-all career plan.
