jobs.title: PRODUCT SUPPORT MANAGER (REMOTE)
jobs.content:
Location: remote; 40 hour/week plus occasional weekends; Start: asap

We are Europeâs largest developer of open source tools for news media. As an organisation, we are at the forefront of developments taking place at the intersection of nonprofit, technology and journalism.

The community around our open source products for media consists of journalists, writers, developers, publishers, open source advocates, existing clients, potential clients and more. We love them all and we want them to love us back. Thatâs why we are looking for an amazing person to communicate with them.

Our Product Support Manager is vital, sitting at the forefront of our organisation and acting as the first point of contact for the community. Being a great communicator with good technical understanding, you will be able to answer incoming enquiries and bring other experts into the conversation as required. You will report to our Head of Support and join a fantastic team made up of two other product support managers.

YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES...
  • Be the first point of contact for all enquiries and keep track of all these conversations 
  • Provide information to potential clients across the range of our product and service offerings including hosted services, paid implementations, support and consulting
  • Manage the accounts of all existing clients across all our systems
  • Regularly liaise a with Sourcefabricâs existing clients and community and share that feedback with the team
  • Provide troubleshooting in instances where things have gone wrong for a client
  • Communicate with the wider Sourcefabric team, relaying the communityâs concerns, wishes, questions and problems to the respective responsible parties

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR...
  • Candidate able to work 18:00-02:00 EST / 08:00-16:00 AEST to cover West coast of the USA and Australia working hours (not necessary to be based in those time zones)
  • Great communicator, written and verbal
  • Good problem solver
  • Ability to understand and convey technical support
  • Ability to gather and relay complex information
  • Fluent in English and very good skills in at least one other language (German preferred)
  • Well organised and flexible self-motivator
  • Team player who can work with little supervision and report effectively
  • Experience with SaaS provisioning and relevant programmes (ideally WHMCS and 2checkout) would be great but are not necessary

WHAT WE OFFER
At Sourcefabric, we know how to work hard, but we also know how to have fun. Our employees are so much more than their jobs, and we recognise that and celebrate it in many ways. From marathon runners to music composers, we continue to learn new and interesting things about our fellow employees every day.

THE PERKSâ¦
  • An international environment: Find yourself surrounded by talented team members from across the globe (more than 14 countries).
  • A competitive work package: This includes flexible working arrangements, fantastic office locations (think Prague, Berlin, Toronto and more) and training opportunities to help you grow and develop your personal skill set.
  • Annual jamboree: Our staff get-together, Sourcecamp, is part hackathon, part show-and-tell, part strategy-wrangling and all fun. We fly everyone from wherever they are based to our chosen location (which could be anywhere) and spend a few days working together and creating great memories in a lovely setting.

HOW TO APPLY

Send us your CV (no more than two pages), a cover letter (including your salary expectations) to jobs@sourcefabric.org.

Deadline: 31 October 2016
Start: asap

Wait for us to reply. Even if we donât think it will be a good fit for the both of us, we will get back to you.

* NO AGENCIES PLEASE. Please note that we only consider applications submitted by individuals, recruiting agencies should refrain from contacting us.

To apply: jobs@sourcefabric.org

jobs.title: System Administrator
jobs.content:
LOCATION: DISTRIBUTED - CANDIDATES MAY WORK REMOTELY BUT SHOULD BE BASED IN EITHER GMT (GREENWHICH MEANS TIME) TIMEZONE GMT-5 (+/-2 HOURS), COVERING NORTH/SOUTH AMERICA OR GMT+12 (+/-2 HOURS) COVERING THE EAST COAST OF AUSTRALIA AND NEW ZEALAND.

Sourcefabric is looking for two System Administrators to join our international team and help maintain the systems and security of the independent media outlets we work with.

Sourcefabric is Europeâs largest developer of open source tools for news media. Headquartered in Prague, Czech Republic Sourcefabric has branches in Berlin and Toronto, and representatives in Belgrade and Cluj. Sourcefabric brings together minds from all corners of the globe to promote media development through the creation of open source software. We have six open source software projects and offer a range of mission-critical hosted and managed solutions for newspapers, websites, radio stations and publishers all over the world. All of our tools are open source and free to download: Superdesk, Newscoop, Booktype, Airtime, Live Blog, and Citizen Desk.
System Administrators are the backbone of our organisation and, yes, of course we celebrated SysAdminDay! 

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR...
  • 5+ years experience as a Linux system administrator or system integrator
  • You are based in either GMT (Greenwhich Means Time) timezone GMT-5 (+/-2 hours), covering North/South America or GMT+12 (+/-2 hours) covering the East Coast of Australia and New Zealand.
  • You should know how to install/configure/optimise/secure/monitor/repair the following:
  • Ubuntu server
  • Web servers: Apache, Nginx
  • Data servers: MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, Redis
  • Monitoring tools: Nagios, Munin, Monit, Sensu
  • File systems, software RAID volumes
  • Server virtualization/container: LXC/LXD, Docker, KVM/Qemu
  • Solid understanding of ARP, TCP/IP, HTTP protocolsShell programmingSSL certificate management: creating, revoking, user/web protectionYou should know how to troubleshoot software/hardware/network issues to identify where a problem is occurring. 
  • We are also looking for the ability to integrate different open source applications together.Excellent spoken and written English, additional languages a plus

While the following aren't deal breakers, it would be great if you had:
  • SQL, PHP and Python programming
  • Amazon services management experience
  • Highload site support

WHAT WE OFFER

At Sourcefabric, we know how to work hard, but we also know how to have fun. Our employees are so much more than their jobs, and we recognise that and celebrate it in many ways. From marathon runners to music composers, we continue to learn new and interesting things about our fellow employees every day.

THE PERKS...

  • Work on meaningful open source projects that make the world a better place.
  • Join an international team: Find yourself surrounded by talented team members from across the globe (over 14 countries to be specific).
  • A competitive package, including flexible working arrangements, comprehensive benefits, and training opportunities to help you grow and develop your personal skill set.
  • Work in an environment that allows you to improve your skills and keep up with the latest development technology; we all enjoy learning from each other.
  • Have your voice heard and considered in the decision-making processes in the company.
  • Annual team get-together: Each year we gather the team in one location for our annual team gathering called Sourcecamp. Past Sourcecamp locations have included Berlin, Prague, and the mountains of Serbia.

HOW TO APPLY

If you believe you are the right candidate, please contact us immediately. We hope to fill this position as soon as possible.

Please send your CV, a short motivational letter (don't forget to mention your timezone!), and examples of projects you've worked on (if you have a Github profile, please share the link) to jobs@sourcefabric.org. Also, don't forget to tell us a little bit about yourself (including how you heard about this position).


* Please note that we only consider applications submitted by individuals, recruiting agencies should refrain from contacting us.
* Applicants must have a valid work permit in country of application.

To apply: Send us a cover letter and resume to jobs@sourcefabric.org

jobs.title: DevOps engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a talented, experienced, full-time DevOps engineer to help us with our infrastructure development. The work relates to both multi-tenant cloud infrastructure (currently hosted in Google compute engine) as well as making sure the product we deliver to customer specific on-premises installations meets the myriad customers needs. In order to thrive in the job, you might occasionally need to touch the backend codebase as well.

REQUIREMENTS

  • A deep understanding of Linux systems and Storage technologies
  • Solid programming skills (Ruby, Ruby on Rails)
  • A dedication to solve problems and deliver solutions
  • Knowledge of version control systems, binary repositories and registries for software asset management

Knowledge in the following technologies is a must:

  • Docker
  • Rails stack
  • Chef
  • Bash
  • Networking
  • Storage solutions
  • Cluster, high-availability and disaster recovery configurations
  • Continuous Delivery, Jenkins
  • Common linux distributions (RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu, Debian)

Bonus points for:
  • Interests in blogging and showing off your work in public.

BENEFITS

We offer possibilities for career progression in the company. You will have an opportunity to make a difference in an innovative tech startup. You will be able to work from anywhere and anytime, as long as you can make some of your working time overlap with business hours in the GMT+3 time zone. Read more about our working culture and hiring process at https://deveo.com/about and check our stack from http://stackshare.io/deveo/deveo

The perfect candidate has a passion for craft and a resume to back it up. Please send us links to your works, Github, Blog or any other resources you are proud of. Also, please attach a cover letter telling about yourself and why do you want to work for Deveo.

To apply: https://deveo.workable.com/jobs/342944/candidates/new

Since 2008 we are a startup at the University Zurich and identify patients at risk using rules and increasingly artificial intelligence. Our group of students, pharmacists and physicians is currently selecting new staff to work with us onsite. You may be employed via the university as a scientist or at the startup.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Web Developer
jobs.content:
Join us in being a part of the global music community by shaping the delivery of digital sheet music.  Musicnotes.com, located in Madison, WI is seeking a Web Developer who has a passion and talent for engaging in the design, development, and testing of the Musicnotes website.  We are a collaborative, “can do” team that is collectively as passionate about music as we are about code!  Your contributions will include:

jobs.title: iOS Engineer
jobs.content:
What We’re Looking For:


We’re looking for an experienced native iOS engineer who has a passion for exercise and music and is looking to working on an established app & platform to help take it to the next level. The ideal person will have:



  • A naturally positive, upbeat attitude with an interest in music & exercise

  • A B.S. or M.S. Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience

  • Excellent object-oriented programming skills in Objective C

  • 4-5+ years of full-time experience developing native iOS applications

  • Experience with RESTful API’s and asynchronous web services

  • Contribution to at least one published app on the App Store

  • Experience working with a music or health-and-fitness product

  • Experience working with small, multi-functional teams, including marketing, design and business development

  • The ability to work independently, taking projects and running with them


Your Responsibilities:

  • Develop automated unit tests

jobs.title: Application Engineer
jobs.content:
Quartzy's marketplace team builds systems to help find our users the best price possible for materials they use every day in their labs. We’re on a quest for an extraordinary application engineer who will join us to help grow and improve our marketplace applications.


You are a self-starter with a bias for action, and you can take projects from start to finish. You want to work as part of a small, tightly-knit team that moves quickly and pushes changes to production many times a day. You always admired your friends in science, but your knack for computers led you to programming.


Quartzy is a global two-sided marketplace for the life sciences. Our platform helps labs order scientific supplies ranging from beakers to capital equipment; we make life easier and save money for scientists and lab managers in academia and at pharma and biotech companies. We give the software away for free and earn revenue when labs buy their supplies from us. With over 200,000 scientists from all over the world relying on Quartzy, we help accelerate the pace of scientific discovery, and we need your help to accelerate our own pace as well.



What you'll do



  • Design and implement new functionality from the ground up

  • Work closely with your team to design and develop features that will empower our users

  • Measure and improve site performance and scalability

  • Write well-tested code that is resilient to heavy iteration 


What we're looking for



  • You have three or more years of experience writing clean, thoughtfully crafted PHP that scales.

  • You have experience with other parts of our technology stack: MySQL, Redis, Beanstalkd, RabbitMQ, nginx, Git.

  • You have the ability and desire to own projects that directly impact Quartzy's bottom line.

  • You are a strong communicator. You write well and can easily explain complex technical concepts to non-technical people. 


What we'd love



  • Background working with mission-critical financial systems

  • Experience with the integration of external financial or ERP systems

  • Familiarity with asynchronous worker queues

  • Experience working in a dynamic startup environment

  • Occasionally, you end the day with more lines of code removed than added; and that feels great



Does that sound like you? We'd love to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Who You Are


You are a web development guru. You take pride in your work, writing clean, maintainable code. You also prioritize and build what’s necessary to accomplish the business objectives at hand. You roll up your sleeves and do whatever is necessary to push the company forward. You have strong back-end skills, but are also comfortable with front-end work and can drive a feature from PSD to functional product.


You Have



  • A GitHub account (or portfolio) that rocks

  • Projects that you can point to that you personally (not your team) built

  • 2+ years of Ruby-on-Rails experience

  • 5-10 years of web development experience, ideally some of which is in a startup environment

  • An understanding of web analytics, A/B testing, and agile development methods

  • An outstanding academic background; CS degree preferred


What You'll Do Here


We're looking for a full stack engineer to help us build amazing products.  We've got a full slate of interesting projects and need an exceptional engineer to help us create innovative technology that will change real estate.  You'll be working on mission critical projects, both on our internal tools and on our customer facing products, and will be able to help shape our engineering culture as we grow.


You Want



  • Your work to matter - to be critically important to your team’s success

  • To work on a small team that gets sh*t done but also likes to have fun

  • To receive a competitive equity/comp package

  • To build cool technology that will transform an industry and forever change the way people buy and sell real estate

jobs.title: Lead Application Developer
jobs.content:
Company Overview:


Pursuant works with nonprofit organizations across the U.S. to pinpoint the right solution(s) mix and develop a framework to help achieve fundraising goals. Our solutions include capital campaigns, major gift counsel, mid-level gift programs, direct response, digital, and media delivered using client services and supporting technologies. Pursuant takes a data-driven approach to solving client challenges. In our view, the data tells a strong story identifying strategic opportunities for fundraising success. We’re dedicated to implementing a solution to increase an organization’s ability for global impact. As the only firm to serve every donor segment across all communication channels, our clients see the difference in the dramatic fundraising results that help them make a greater impact every day.


Position Overview: 


A development team lead is an integral part of the SaaS team. This role will be involved in all facets of the software build process. The development team lead is a part of a fast paced, agile development cycle, which enables the team to create and push new code through our processes quickly and efficiently. This role will mentor and lead other developers on our team, helping them grow in their knowledge of the platform and industry standards while keep your hands in new feature development. The lead will guide the team through the full-life cycle of development, managing their daily workflow, scoping out new work, researching bugs, and aiding different departments in needed requests.


Desired Profile:


Seeing ideas come to life through technology is your passion. You are energized working with a team, managing their daily workflow, aiding in their development as a person and as a professional. Technology and team building drives you. You understand and appreciate that coding is an art form; continuous work, research, innovation, and refinement are necessary to achieve a solid solution. Given minimal information, you can root out the cause of an issue and implement a maintainable resolution. You are ready, willing, and able to run into a burning production emergency while remaining calm, cool, and collected. You do all this while continuing to keep your hands elbow deep in code and industry trends.


Experience:



  • 3+ years managing daily activities of a development team in a SaaS environment

  • 3+ years working in an agile environment

  • 5+ years working withC based language, PHP required

    • OOP standards knowledge

    • Experience with a framework (Laravel 5, Symfony 1.x or 2.x, Zend, etc.)



  • 5+ years experience MySQL

    • Experience in database design

    • Experience writing procedures and triggers



  • 5+ years JS experience

    • Experience with using various libraries (Bootstrap, Prototype, jQuery, etc.)

    • Experience coding browser compatible JS without the use of a library



  • 5+ years experience working with API’s (AuthNet, Paypal, Salesforce, Mailgun)

  • 3+ years experience with code management software, GIT preferred (SVN, CVS, etc.)

  • 3+ years HTML experience

    • Experience building html pages and emails

    • Experience working in software with pre-built pages and ability to keep the coding and the look and feel consistent



  • 3+ years CSS experience

    • Experience working with web pages or software that requires a common look and feel using standard, accepted CSS



  • 3+ years working on a live SaaS product

  • 3+ years CLI (command line interface) experience

    • Comfortable using basic commands in a Linux environment

    • VIM experience

    • Accessing and using MySQL through a CLI



  • Experience with email deliverability a plus

  • Nonprofit experience a plus


Competencies / Work Style:



  • Strong mentoring skill set

  • Attention to detail

  • Effective communicator

  • Flexible, can handle changes in direction and interruptions

  • Effectively manages deadlines and deliverables across team

  • Accurately estimates timelines for projects across team

  • Firm grasp of personal strengths and weaknesses

  • Excellent listener with an openness to other’s ideas



  • Willingness to learn

  • Receives and offers constructive feedback in a positive manner


Position Responsibilities:



  • Manage daily workflow, prioritizing items as needed for app development team

  • Create coherent, well structured design plans for CoS (Conditions of Satisfaction)

  • Collaborate with team to review, size, and work down feature backlog

  • Support recruiting process to phone screen, in-person interview, select and onboard top talent

  • Provide performance feedback to team members on an informal basis (daily/weekly) as well as a formal basis (annual review) to support team member growth

  • Lead and be actively involved in the code and functional reviews of developer work, being able to spot logic and functional issues and effectively communicate feedback

  • Work with support to diagnose client specific issues as they relate to the various facets of our product

  • Code according to industry and team standards, adhering to OOP principles

  • Share knowledge with other team members by providing feedback and offering guidance from your experience

  • Work with QA team to pass off feature and bug fixes for testing with clear, comprehensive test cases, providing guidance on new features and impacted parts of the product

  • Lead and actively engage other team members during meetings to discuss backlog items, design issues, and best coding practices

  • Document processes, features and functions in a development Wiki

  • Participate in SaaS product roadmap process

  • Reward and celebrate the team for work well done


Location:


This position will be based out of our Corporate Office in Dallas, TX. However, we will consider candidates from any location able to work remotely.

jobs.title: Software Solutions Architect
jobs.content:

jobs.title: Junior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Purpose of Job


Human Longevity, Inc. is looking for an Junior Software Engineer to work cross-functionally with DevOps, Software Quality and Data Engineering to manage, support and optimize the systems delivering big data for one of the largest whole genome sequencing facilities in the world.


Tasks and Responsibilities


The Junior Software Engineer will be responsible for the support and enhancement of HLI’s core platform technology. The candidate will interact not only with other team members in supporting and building different components of the system, but also with scientists, bioinformaticians and non-engineers. The candidate must be conscientious, detail oriented and be dedicated to seeing tasks through to completion. Above all the candidate must have a passion for learning and technology. This is a great opportunity to grow your engineering skill set and learn new technologies in a creative & dynamic start up environment.

jobs.title: Software QA Engineer
jobs.content:
Human Longevity, Inc. is looking for a Software QA or SDET to ensure quality application systems development of HLI’s core platform technology supporting “omics” and bioinformatics analysis. 


Tasks and Responsibilities


The Software QA Engineer candidate will work closely with the quality and engineering teams to develop automated tests, execute software test plans and procedures compliant with software testing ISO standards.  The ideal candidate will be knowledgeable in current test platforms and strategies including testing software in Cloud (AWS), Windows (C# .NET), Web (Node.js Angular.js) and Linux (C/C++/Python) environments.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you an extremely pragmatic developer who knows how to capture, simplify, implement, and test core domain concepts? Are you a top-notch student from a top-notch school? Are you able to parse through 1000s of lines of legacy code and patch a flaw in a crunch? Have you refactored large legacy projects using SOLID principles, DDD, and a test harness? Can you build out a loosely coupled service portfolio from tightly coupled libraries? Are you intimately familiar with issues of scale and availability? Are you interested in working with a group where you are encouraged to find the right tool to solve a given problem, rather than being told, "this is the way we’ve always done it"?


BillingTree is enhancing its service portfolio with a high-performance distributed payments system that must embody service-oriented principles, be reliable, secure, stateless, loosely coupled, contract-oriented, autonomous, discoverable, composable, interoperable, etc.


The responsibilities of this role would be to leverage your strengths to help BillingTree build best-in-class software. It is a serious challenge, and it will tap on a wide range of software skills including cloud architecture, code maintenance, horizontal scaling, distributed development, redundancy and failover, security, metrics, analysis, brownfield development, continuous integration, etc.

    Concur, the most profitable and fastest growing Software as a Service provider in the world, is looking for an analytical Software Development Engineer in Test to join our global QA organization dedicated to driving the highest quality of service for 30 million users of our cutting-edge Travel & Expense Management Software.

    Now is the time to join the US Government Travel & Expense solution. This is the most valuable single contract for Concur, which means you will be working on a very high visibility/high impact project for the company.

    This is a rare opportunity to come in on the ground floor, grow with the team and have real impact on an extremely valuable project. You will be a member of an Agile team and have your say on how the product increments are to be tested, finding the perfect balance between manual and automated testing.

    The QA team for this project covers the full stack of technologies and products that make up the Government solution and we are looking for engineers to place on Agile teams focusing on various components like Web UI, Business Intelligence/Analytics, Mobile, MidTier/WebServices.

jobs.content:
Peoplefluent RMS 5

jobs.content: The Content Services team is responsible for web services used by all Hulu clients. jobs.title: Video Encoding Software Developer for Hulu!
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


The Video Encoding team is responsible for having the best looking video on the Internet with the least amount of bits and takes ownership for the different renditions of video- everything from mobile to TV. The team is responsible for the packaging of content, both DRM and protocol delivery formats. Delivering video to an iOS device is much different then delivering video to a XBOX One. The team is responsible for end-to-end UX for video delivery. It is a small big data problem. Our players collect information about user’s playback experience, these key metrics are aggregated near real time and use them to make decisions on how we route traffic to clients.We are looking for a talented Software Developer to help us build the most sophisticated powerful video transcoding engine in the industry. Hulu is all about high quality video content, and that begins with reliable, efficient, and high-quality transcoding.


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Drive the digital video transcoding and delivery pipeline for the world’s premium online video service

  • Improve storage efficiency of a multi Petabyte distributed file system

  • Design tools to perform automated analysis of videos

  • Sweat every millisecond of latency

  • Dream of the next big thing in video streaming

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - For Hulu's Devices Team
jobs.content:
SUMMARY


The Platform Devices team at Hulu creates the platform that Hulu clients run on such as VR, Apple TV, PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo, and more. Our small, high-performing team contributes to the Hulu client in the fastest-growing segment of Hulu traffic, on all the best devices, the very day those devices ship. Everything we do directly affects millions of consumers, their experience with our service, and Hulu’s business. Most recently, the Platform Devices team released Hulu VR on the Samsung GearVR and more are in the works.We’re looking for a senior front-end developer who loves modern 10-foot UI. We are building the best Video on Demand (VOD) experience the living room has ever seen, and we work with a plethora of different technologies, teams, and partners to do so. We are reinventing television. If you’re looking for a challenge, you’ve come to the right place!


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Work closely with UX designers, product managers, and engineering leadership to create best-of-class, delightful TV-watching experiences.

  • Implement the UI for new features and initiatives, working closely with the developers of the Hulu web site and mobile apps.

  • Help push the envelope in the emerging Virtual Reality space.

  • Provide guidance for other developers via paired programming, feedback, code reviews, and otherwise.

jobs.title: Senior Information Technology Application Analyst
jobs.content:
Senior Information Technology Application Analyst Job








Christiana Care Health System is hiring an Application Analyst to support existing and new applications within the Centricity/Ambulatory/VNA Team. We are looking for skills on the application platform to include client and server side.

As a Senior Information Technology Application your primary work is:

• Responsible for software implementations, upgrades, configuration and support of multiple Ambulatory/Clinical applications
• Emphasis for this position will be on assisting with the management of the technical environments of Ambulatory/Clinical applications supporting our physician practices and home care agency
• Responsible for troubleshooting technical issues within homecare and the Ambulatory practices and providing customer support for existing and new applications
• Responsible for working directly with vendor and customer to log incidents and follow up with open issues
• Engage directly with VNA mobile workforce on technical issues directly affecting the delivery of patient care
• Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation with support team to support clinical and VNA EMR customers
• Responsible for learning and supporting new clinical applications and business areas
• Participate in RUSA (Reliability, Usability, Serviceability, and Availability) calls and follow downtime instructions for testing and communicating to team members and customers
• Responsible for engaging in evaluation and testing of new technologies with emphasis on interoperability

Education & Experience:

• Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Business Administration, or experience consistent with the Application/Senior Application Analyst job responsibilities
• At least six years of experience planning and executing the technical installation or upgrade of new and existing enterprise software applications
• At least four years of experience developing database queries (Oracle, MSSQL - including the ability to write complex queries using PL/SQL and/or T-SQL)
• At least four years of experience working with clinical data developing metrics, dashboards and pivot tables is highly preferred
• Experience working in a healthcare environment is preferred

jobs.title: Senior Network Systems Analyst
jobs.content:
Senior Network Systems Analyst


The IT Department is currently recruiting for a Senior Network Analyst to join their team!
You will be part of the IT Network team which supports the Christiana Care's data and voice network infrastructure. This position will provide primary support for the data network which includes LAN, WAN, WLAN for all Christiana Care sites including 2 hospitals, 2 data centers and over 30 remote sites. The team provides support for over 32,000 connected wired and wireless devices, 300+ network devices including switches, routers, load balancers, firewalls, wireless controllers, SSL/VPN’s, Fiber distribution systems, Distributed Antenna System for Cellular coverage and Digital TV Head Ends.

For this position you should be at a Sr. Network Engineer level or equivalent typically 8-12 years of network experience.



• Consideration will be given to those with slightly less experience if there is proven ability to learn quickly and take on more responsibility.
• This person should process strong knowledge of IP data networks including routing protocols such as OSPF and BGP and network switch configuration including VLANs (Enterasys/Extreme preferred).
• Experience with firewalls (Palo Alto preferred) and/ or Load Balancers (Citrix NetScalers – preferred) would be extremely beneficial.
• Experience with wireless networks would also be extremely beneficial – Aruba Networks preferred. Possession of good network troubleshooting skills including an understanding of protocols such as DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP, as well as the ability to capture, read and diagnose network traces with products such as Wireshark are essential.
• The ability to work well as part of a team and with intradepartmental teams is of prime importance.
• The individual is expected to have an understanding of various network monitoring tools using SNMP and syslog messages. Current tools being used include Spectrum, LogLogic, SevOne, Netsight and AMP.
• This position will require on call coverage of a week at a time which will be rotated with the other members of the team for an average of 8 weeks per year.
• This position will also work with some direction and input from our Network Architect.
This individual needs to be self-motivated to learn and apply the inner workings of the more complex data network equipment, applications and tools. Proven educational and responsibility growth in previous jobs would be expected. The incumbent in this role must maintain good communication at all times, provide technical assistance, support, education, training and standards to IT staff. Possess the ability to write effective support documentation for the areas they support.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

• Requires a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent degree or the minimal equivalent experience of 4-8 years in a Network Systems Analyst/Engineer position.
• An equivalent combination of education, industry certifications and experience may be substituted. Network Certifications such as CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, CWNA, CCWP or similar are desirable.

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description: Full Stack Developer


We’re a growing company that maintains a SaaS local marketing automation platform and we’re looking for a full-stack developer to join our team.



We manage enterprise-level SaaS platforms for Fortune 500 customers and need an engineer who is a developer at heart but gets the big picture. Our web-based platform produces all forms of advertising from ads, flyers, emails, flash banners, HTML5 landing pages, restaurant menus and any other advertising collateral you can think of.



What is local marketing automation?


Our customers are mid to large size brands that have many local locations. Marketers at those locations want to build brand marketing materials that allows them to customize the material to their needs, without violating brand standards. Our tool allows the brand to lock down the aspects they don’t want to be editable while still empowering the local user to customize the parts that make the material unique to them.


Who we Seek


We need a developer that can help see a project from beginning to end. An ideal candidate would be able to understand our customer’s needs for a feature, help the project manager come up with a specification, implement, and deploy it.


Skills & Requirements



  • 4+ years experience with PHP
    BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent
    JavaScript - experience with a framework is a plus
    Source Control
    HTML/CSS



Technology We Use



  • Primarily PHP 7.0

  • JavaScript

  • HTML/CSS

  • js

  • Apache/Nginx

  • RabbitMQ

  • PostgreSQL

  • Elasticsearch

  • Git

  • Zend framework

  • Perl





About Pica9 Inc.


Benefits
Healthcare coverage with three robust options to choose from and available family coverage.
Dental and vision
401K plan participation after three months.
$10,000 life insurance policy
Disability insurance
Discounts on goods and services at local and national businesses- 50% of your next haircut just for being a team member? Sign us up!
“Unlimited PTO”



If you think you have the right mix of technology know-how and personal dynamic for this role and our environment, please send your resume.

jobs.title: VP Product Development
jobs.content:
Job Description: VP of Product Development


Reporting to the General Manager of CampaignDrive, the VP of Product Development is responsible for working with teams of developers, project managers, QA Specialists, and UX/UI Designers to deliver roadmap items and correct defects in our SaaS application within expected timeframes. The ideal candidate has a proven track record managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle, creating an environment conducive to team self-organization, and coaching and motivating cross functional teams.

  • Establishing deliverables and timeframes and developing and overseeing iterative product release plans showing key milestones

  • Working with agile teams to define product backlogs

  • Assuring the overall functionality, performance, and quality of the produc

  • Managing product development process (from initial planning, to development, functional documentation, testing, demos, and release)

  • Working with Product Management and Customer Success teams to prioritize and schedule the CampaignDrive road map

  • Creating and adjusting processes and procedures to accommodate shifting business requirements and capacity

  • Maintaing a master project plan for the development, testing, documentation, and implementation of all new features and bugs

Requirements



  • Ability to work in our NYC offices on a full-time basis

jobs.title: Senior C/C++ Engineer - Video/Image Codec
jobs.content:
To make our software, Astropad, possible we had to create our own network protocol and low-latency video codec we call Liquid. We are just getting started with Liquid and we need engineers to help us work on this next generation high quality, low-latency video technology.


We are looking for someone with an interest in low level programming (C, SIMD), graphics, GPU programming and compression to work on our cutting edge Liquid tech. We are also a fully remote company with a small office in Minneapolis, MN. If this sounds interesting to you, please get in touch!

jobs.title: ASP.NET Back-End Developer
jobs.content:
It’s not magic. It’s our back-end developers kicking butt behind-the-scenes that make super hard things look super simple.


Real Art is seeking a Back-End Developer with a specialty in ASP.NET to join our Chicago team. In this position you will work alongside designers and developers to deliver elegant programming solutions from development to testing to release, using the latest tools and technologies. You must have impeccable technical skills as well as a passion for learning new things and an incredible sense of modern web design and systems.


In this role, you will be charged with programming and implementing server-side software and systems into interactive media. Our ideal candidate brings technical experience in both web development and web servers. In addition, you work quickly and efficiently to solve problems with attention to detail, are able to manage multiple projects effortlessly, meet deadlines, and work collaboratively with team members across Real Art’s diverse disciplines. Most importantly, we are looking for a fun-loving individual who loves the work they do, and believes in pushing at the bounds of what’s possible.


Responsibilities & Skills:



  • Programming, testing, and implementation of server-side software and systems

  • Up-to-date knowledge of latest technologies and ability to troubleshoot difficult problems

  • Recommend architecture and design optimizations to improve the scalability of the applications and maximize performance

  • Excellent capability in ASP.NET 4.0+

  • Fluency in back-end technologies of MSSQL, IIS, LINQ, C#, and OAuth

  • Understanding of the MVC pattern, WCF services, and integration of CMS systems

  • Work directly with designers, UX and development teams

  • Write clean, maintainable and testable code

  • Ability to navigate additional languages is a huge bonus


About Real Art:


Real Art combines the never-before-seen with the why-didn’t-I-think of that. Blending art and invention, we get people to discover and remember our clients. Our team includes digital designers, print designers, industrial designers, developers, technologists, writers, engineers, and fabricators. We handle projects from strategy and concept through production and implementation. Real Art serves a growing roster of the world’s top brands from our offices in New York, Chicago, and our new 25,000-square foot headquarters and development lab in Dayton, Ohio.


To apply, send your resume to jobs [at] realart.com.


Real Art will not sponsor applicants for work visas.

jobs.title: Wicked Brilliant Software Developer
jobs.content:
Windward’s software engineers are a team of very smart & motivated developers who work extremely well together.  What you do at Windward matters – a lot.  And you’ll find that you’re consistently pushed to learn more - and to create brilliant software. Learn more about our A player team here: http://blogs.windward.net/


Our core offering is a reporting/document generation product in which templates are designed using Microsoft Word, Excel, and/or PowerPoint – which means we have truly made report design significantly easier.  We’re now doing the same with a browser- based offering.  Our mantra is to be, by far, the easiest-to-use system available.


The core engine is written in Java and compiled using both Java (for the Java engine) and IKVM (for the .NET engine).  The Office Add-In is written in C#.  Our server solutions are written in C# and use the Azure stack.  Our browser-based editor is written in TypeScript and uses Sencha (Javascript) for the UI.


As a mid-level developer you will be a key contributor behind development projects and crucial to the successful execution and maintenance of all of Windward’s projects. You will improve the long term quality of the code you develop through unit and functional testing to ensure our customer satisfaction rates stay at 99%. The ideal candidate will have experience in both front and back-end development, as well as the drive to work within a large, complex system using a variety of programming languages and technologies. Your work will be customer facing, and have a substantial impact on the user experience, consistency and reliability of a reporting product that makes people in a variety of industries, happy.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description:


CSG Actuarial is looking for a software engineer who can hit the ground running.  Our development team releases new product and services each week to thousands of customers, so we are looking for someone who can take on challenges, build new features, and integrate quickly.


Each engineer has a role in building our technology and will have an opportunity to touch each part of the platform.  Our team is small, but produces high impact products and services. This allows you to see projects from start to finish, and work closely with other engineers, product managers, and designers to ensure successful results.


Responsibilities:



  • Create scalable web and mobile device applications

  • Working with our product and design team to build new features, tools, and functionality to Improve our web service

  • Utilize data mining techniques to keep database information current

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer @ Kink.com - NSFW
jobs.content:
Kink.com is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to join our awesome team in the heart of San Francisco’s Mission District.


What we need...


We’re looking for someone who is a creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently and collaboratively. This person should be excited to take on the following responsibilities:



  • Redesign and implement scalable data ingestion and processing systems

  • Build solutions to capture, store and retrieve data for our affiliate and analytics platforms

  • Design and build a recommendation system for our consumer-facing site

  • Help maintain and improve code quality through unit tests, automation and performing code reviews

  • A forward thinker who’s not afraid to document and diagram work and communicate issues as appropriate

  • Help troubleshoot production issues when they arise

  • Eagerly dive into difficult problems and successfully deliver results

jobs.title: Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
We're looking to hire a Drupal developer with a good grip on PHP and module development. That's about all you probably need to know if you want to apply, so we'll spend the rest of the text limit here telling you about the job.


Who we are: Sourcetoad is a dev studio in Tampa, FL. We work with some pretty huge clients, on really interesting projects. You will not be bored here, guaranteed.


We don't have any non-technical staff. Our project managers are programmers, our business developers are made to learn to code, so this is a nerdy place to work. 


What we do:


We build mobile apps, middleware, and web applications, and we do it well. On the backends, we like working with frameworks (mainly Laravel and Yii2, but a lot of Drupal too), and would want you to have experience with one of those or something similar. 


What you get: Competitive pay, health, dental, and vision insurance. We give our people top of the line equipment, cool toys, and a casual, supportive work environment... oh, and free beer. You will get time to work on a passion project, and have support of the company behind you, and a developer-centric management philosophy. We try and make it a fun place to work, and to give developers a place where they can learn, grown, and build awesome stuff.

jobs.title: Software Engineer or Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
SomaLogic is a privately-owned biomedical science company that developed a revolutionary proteomics technology capable of measuring thousands of different proteins in a single small sample. We are a dedicated team of scientists, bioinformaticians, statisticians, and software developers working to build new tools based on our technology that will change the way life science research is done and healthcare is delivered. Come apply your technical expertise to making healthcare better for your loved ones and the whole world.


We are looking for a skilled software engineer to help build and expand our scientific data applications. We are a small agile/lean software team working on web applications for storing and managing scientific and biomedical data. You will participate in, and provide guidance for, all facets of the software development life cycle. Level commensurate with experience.


Key Job Responsibilities



  • Engage in full-stack web application development using JavaScript, HTML, Java, and SQL

  • Write object/functional Java 8 code for enhancements to a database-backed web applications

  • Create and implement new software features while helping to maintain and improve legacy applications

  • Become a contributing member of our software team: interact with the team, give and receive feedback on code design, and take the lead on subprojects to drive them to completion

  • Develop new ideas to help shape our agile software development processes and practices

jobs.title: Web Development Team Lead
jobs.content:
What we do:
Design, Develop, and host data rich, full featured, and high traffic web and mobile applications for financial institutions, brokerages, and media clients from all over the world. We leverage a combination of our mature .NET stack along with the latest and greatest the industry has to offer to deliver some of the fastest and most utilized applications in the financial industry.

What you'll do:
• Lead a team of developers who are building amazing web sites for some of the biggest names in the financial industry.
• Mentor developers of all levels, evangelizing your knowledge and best practices to colleagues
• Take deep ownership and shape the future of your team and your applications
• Work directly with clients to improve their current offerings in addition to conceptualizing new ways to engage with their clients

How you'll do it:
• Use your experience in estimation and architecture to accurately size projects and choose approaches • Satisfy your natural craving for problem solving by building proof-of-concepts and designing applications
• Tap into years of .NET and web experience to peer review code and pair program through tricky requirements
• You're smart and motivated enough to find a way, even if you don't know how yet
• You will help balance project timelines and team commitments in an exciting fast paced environment

Where we're going:
Hot on the heels of moving our service oriented architecture to the cloud and automating our deployments and configurations, we'll be rolling out new tools to our stack like Angular, React, and .NET Core. We are always on the lookout for ways to make our sites more secure, scalable, and fast. We are continuing to explore our wealth of new data sources outside of the financial markets to pioneer new market spaces like virtual and augmented reality.

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
What we do:


Design, Develop, and host data rich, full featured, and high traffic web and mobile applications for financial institutions, brokerages, and media clients from all over the world. Our dedicated development teams work directly with clients to produce some of the fastest and most utilized applications in the financial industry.


What you’ll do:



  • Work directly with a team of developers who are building amazing web sites for some of the biggest names in the financial industry

  • Contribute to both client and server side codebases

  • Be the driving force behind sprint based development

  • Work directly with clients to improve their current offerings in addition to conceptualizing new ways to engage with their clients

  • Assemble deployments that will be pushed to tens of thousands of users


How you’ll do it:



  • Lead individual module and app development with a focus on technical aspects of user stories

  • Combine your experience with front end frameworks such as bootstrap, angular, and react with your understanding of MVC to build interactive components

  • Support new and legacy code while balancing project priorities

  • Provide accurate and realistic estimates for user stories

  • Tap into your years of web development experience to peer review code and pair program through tricky requirements

  • Sprint with your teammates through our well defined SDLC

  • Communicate personal progress in Agile Sprint cycle


Where we’re going:


Hot on the heels of moving our service oriented architecture to the cloud and automating our deployments and configurations, we’ll be rolling out new tools to our stack like Angular, React, and .NET Core. We are always on the lookout for ways to make our sites more secure, scalable, and fast. We are continuing to explore our wealth of new data sources outside of the financial markets to pioneer new market spaces like virtual and augmented reality.


What you know:


Semantic HTML, CSS (Less or Sass a plus!), responsive web development, MVC, OO programming principles, jQuery, Bootstrap, Source Control (Git or SVN), what a strongly typed language is, how to build applications with APIs, how to translate requirements into an actual application.


What you’ll learn:


.NET MVC architecture, C#, Jira, Agile methodologies, Gitflow, advanced JavaScript design patterns, Teamcity (continuous integration), Node.js, Gulp, APIs, Swagger, developing applications for all devices.

jobs.title: Linux Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
We are seeking a systems engineer to lead the ongoing management of JibJab's physical, cloud and IT environments.  This position will be both hands-on and responsible for managing a small team of system administrator / DevOps personnel.  Candidates should be able to understand and work with our existing architecture and help drive future architecture planning and implementation.


We are migrating some systems from a traditional hosting environment to Amazon AWS.  Candidates need to be comfortable with both traditional hosting and AWS, understanding that in the long term, the focus of this position will be on AWS.


We seek a pragmatist.  We value architectural simplicity and ease of management over sophistication.  Put bluntly, we want someone who  prefers to use established, simple, and reliable tools and processes.   We've been around for a decade and we're in this for the long haul.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES:



  • Management of hardware/software in the traditional hosting environment.

  • Management of Production, Testing, and Integration server environments within AWS and assistance in execution of software deployments to Testing and Production environments.

  • Lead consolidation and transition efforts as we migrate from traditional hosting environment to AWS.

  • Active participation in capacity planning, security monitoring, system monitoring and maintenance, incident resolution, system architecture, tools, and process.

  • Some participation in management of our office network (e.g., in management of the VPN tunnel), although desktop support is handled separately.

  • Identifying processes that need to be automated and development of tools to build, maintain, and monitor systems and improve our platform.

  • Identifying and improving security and performance of our systems.

  • Creation of documentation, processes, and standards that are easy to understand and reproducible by others.

jobs.title: Senior front-end web developer
jobs.content:
Decisio Health’s FDA-cleared clinical intelligence platform includes a real-time dashboard and a web-based mobile application. We need a senior front-end web developer to help us support the requirements of a growing customer base.


Our apps are written primarily in Ember and communicate with a variety of Python-powered API backends that provide data over HTTP, often using websockets or server-sent events. We also use HTML5, CSS3, Less and other modern front-end technology.



What you'll be doing:



  • Building data-intensive JavaScript applications

  • Designing innovative visualizations for medical data

  • Working with customers to understand changing UI requirements

  • Making sure our interfaces are accessible and usable

  • Helping to implement and evolve our established style guidelines

  • Ensuring our apps are testable and conform to regulatory requirements

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Quantcast’s new Seattle office is looking for awesome engineers interested in solving juicy technical challenges. We’re a successful pre-IPO big-data company building our next-generation analytics engine that empowers our customers by improving the way they understand their audiences. Quantcast receives millions of data points per second and is aiming to turn that stream into immediately available and actionable insights for our customers. Quantcast pioneered internet audience measurement and is now looking to revolutionize the field again. As an engineer on the Seattle team, you’ll help design and build systems that produce industry-changing analytics and enable our customer to work with us in new ways. Processing petabytes of data per day, devising new ways of understanding the data, and scaling out the systems to support internet-scale audiences are just some of the challenging problems you’ll tackle. To accomplish this, you’ll be joining a team of startup veterans and senior engineers that will make this ambitious vision a market-changing reality.


Responsibilities:



  • Launch, iterate, and have end-to-end impact on our new high-visibility product

  • Solve complex big-data problems in a highly-scalable and maintainable way

  • Work with customers to implement improvements in a lightweight agile environment

  • Establish office culture as a founding member of the Seattle team

jobs.title: Recruiter
jobs.content:
Quantcast is at the forefront of ad tech and big data. We hire the best and brightest from the industry across the entire company and Recruiting is no exception. In a market with billions at stake and a competitive environment that sees a handful of companies come and go every day, the work we do has a direct impact on Quantcast's goal to become a legendary, independently-viable company.  

We are looking for a driven, energetic recruiter to maintain a close relationship with hiring managers at all levels of the organization. As the point of contact in our Austin office this person will have the opportunity to establish best hiring practices and create our recruiting culture. This is truly a unique opportunity to grow our teams and create partnerships with the hiring teams across a wide variety of markets. 

The ideal candidate will have an established track record of hiring for companies with rigorous interview practices in the technology space. This is a full-cycle recruiting position with an emphasis on engaging passive candidates at all levels in sales and sales support. 

Responsibilities:

  • Source and manage candidates for sales and business operations positions in multiple locations and at various levels of seniority
  • Extend, negotiate and close offers to potential hires
  • Partner with department heads, leverage their networks, and facilitate effective outreach strategies
  • Build relationships with hiring managers, develop deep understanding of their positions/needs, and maintain a high-bar candidate pool
  • Interview candidates and manage their experience throughout the hiring process
  • Ability to support headcount expansion into new markets

Requirements:

  • BA/BS degree
  • 2+ years of relevant full-cycle recruitment experience
  • Experience hiring for marquee companies or start-ups with rigorous interview procedures
  • Ability to source independently and partner with hiring managers to build pipeline of high-caliber passive talent
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Persistence, resourcefulness, and sense of urgency

About Quantcast 
Quantcast is a digital advertising company specialized in audience measurement and real-time advertising. As the pioneer of direct audience measurement in 2006, Quantcast has today the most in-depth understanding of digital audiences across the web, allowing marketers and publishers to make the smartest choices as they buy and sell the most effective targeted advertising on the market. Quantcast is dedicated to making display as relevant and effective as search, and currently delivers outstanding advertising campaigns for the world's leading advertisers and publishers and brings accurate audience measurement to over 100 million web destinations.

jobs.title: Senior Front-End Engineer, Publisher Engineering
jobs.content:
Quantcast’s publisher engineering team is responsible for developing products to deliver valuable audience insights and products to publishers. As a Senior front-end Engineer you will help define the front-end architecture, and direction of the product. You will work closely with our Product Design team to bring their designs to life, while keeping your eye on the future with re-usability always at the front of mind.

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role be excited to see their user interface being used by customers, and spot usability and code issues before customers. You should be comfortable implementing APIs (in Java) that are required for a complete implementation of a user interface.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Work with your team to determine product direction and customer needs

  • Develop interactive user interfaces using modern frameworks (in particularly AngularJS)

  • Share knowledge and best practises amongst the publisher engineering team and the wider engineering team

  • Participate in a team-wide on-call rotation to keep the systems ticking along

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Prospecting
jobs.content:
The Prospecting team’s vision is to help our customers better understand their audiences and to deliver relevant advertising across all internet media. The team builds and operates real time prediction and control systems that power all our advertising products at scale. This means getting up-close and personal with cutting edge machine learning techniques and advertising delivery systems. You’ll have the opportunity to leverage Quantcast’s massive computing power to build tens of thousands of predictive models, use these models to make over 2 million advertising decisions per second, and deliver advertising to relevant audiences 24x7.

We are looking for top tier talent to solve day-to-day advertising campaign issues, identify opportunities to improve our machine learning and advertising delivery technologies, and implement those improvements to reach relevant audiences on behalf of our advertisers. We are interested in Senior Software Engineers with a strong production development background as well as a keen interest in data analysis, machine learning and control systems. You might have used one of our open source projects like QFS,or maybe you’ve read our blog post on how we manage the key-value distributed store using Keebler. If this sounds like you, join the team that’s building the next generation pacing services.

jobs.title: Director / Head of Learning and Development
jobs.content:
Reporting to the VP, People and Places, the Director/Head of, Learning and Development will be responsible for the development of Quantcast’s global learning strategy on all topics pertaining to manager capability, leadership skills and skill sets associated with our core competencies. The ideal candidate is a broad and creative thinker, who is passionate about making a big impact in learning and development.    

Resonsibilities

  • Oversee the development and execution of scalable training programs.  Ensure that the content and programming meets the highest standards and relevancy for all audiences.  Manage the implementation and evaluation process to ensure that behavioral and process changes match the intended results.
  • Make full use of technology, instructor led, blended, and experiential learning to improve the quality of training delivery and content accessibility.
  • Develop learning curriculum paths for all positions in the company.  Leverage data to measure and inform future curriculum planning.
  • Lead executive onboarding and development curriculum strategies.
  • Partner with cross-functional leaders to identify and prioritize learning development needs.
  • Engage support and buy-in cross-functionally from leadership teams to help drive organizational change and helps to foster a learning culture.
  • Execute special projects as requested by the VP, People and Places.  This involves, and is not limited to, creation and development of programs, evaluation and revision of existing programs, and leading management and education workshops in local markets and national conferences.    

Requirements

  • At least 10 years of direct experience scaling and leading a Learning and Development function in a rapidly growing organization is required
  • Strong verbal, written and presentation skills
  • Previous experience in high tech / ad tech is preferred
  • Ability to travel as required
  • Bachelors degree, or equivalent experience
  • Experience implementing LMS is required

Quantcast helps create a more personalized digital world. We have built one of the world’s most sophisticated data-intelligence platforms, utilizing big data and machine learning to solve the biggest challenges in marketing and create more rewarding experiences across the digital landscape. Publishers use our insights to better understand audiences and how content resonates with consumers they want to attract and retain. Marketers utilize our understanding of online behavior and our predictive advertising capabilities to reach the customers likeliest to engage with their messages. Consumers see the results of our work in relevant stories and advertisements that create a personalized experience across all of their devices. 

Quantcast was honored as a Glassdoor Best Place to Work in 2015 and 2016. To learn more, follow Quantcast on Glassdoor.

jobs.title: Hadoop Data Architect
jobs.content:
The Data Architect assume overall technical responsibility for the design and implementation of end-to-end, large scale complex solutions, that integrate data from desperate systems, and delivers business solutions typically over a multi-tenant cloud environment. The Data Architect also advises on engineering practices, development environments, and processes.


Skills & Requirements




  • Architect Big Data software systems for complex data analytics requirements, including data processing, analytics and Reporting.

  • Design and Develop complex software components and tools to create a high throughput data processing platform.

  • Design and Develop high performance, high-available, scalable data processing software frameworks and data models.

  • Establish reference data architecture and technology roadmap in line with the business strategy.

  • Lead Infrastructure planning and security definitions.

  • Evaluate alternatives, process requirements, and collaborate with rest of the team for effective solutions.

  • Deliver projects on-time and to specification with quality.

  • Provide leadership and mentorship to developers, and testers.

  • Champion Non-Functional Requirements and evolve Architecture to meet increasing expectations and reduce technical debt.

  • Bachelor's degree in science with 8+ years of relevant work experience.

  • 3+ years of experience in architecting Distributed Systems, Big Data Solutions, Analytics and Reporting.

  • Hands on experience in Hadoop Technologies and tools, like Hive, HBase, Sqoop, Pig Script, Map Reduce, Spark, Core Java and Kafka is a must.

  • Experience building distributed, scalable, reliable and high throughput data pipelines; message queues that ingest and process data at scale and in real-time; and high performance batch data processing is expected.

  • Experience with SQL (Structured Query Language) is an advantage.

  • Experience with other related tools and technologies in Hadoop ecosystems, like Scala, Storm, Zookeeper, Tez, Flume, Oozie, JSON, NoSQL, Cloudera distribution, etc. is desired.

  • Experience with IaaS Cloud Infrastructure.

  • Experience in applying standard design methodologies and best practices.

  • Ability to translate complex concepts to technical solutions.

  • Ability to assess alternatives objectively.

  • Passion for working with big data, with focus on scalability and simplicity.

  • Passion to learn and evangelize new technologies.

  • Experience with Agile development teams and good inter-personal skills.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Test
jobs.content:
Summary


As our Senior Software Engineer in Test you will be influential in helping to set the vision on where to take our Automation Framework. You will work within our Innovation team focused on Research and Development and immediately contribute to critical and challenging problems within the QA/Engineering environment. We’re looking for a proactive SSET who has passion and desire to work with a highly collaborative, start-up mentality focused team.


Role and Responsibilities:



  • The candidate must have proven experience as a senior engineer with project leadership experience

  • Must be able to lead a small automation team to ensure automation project work is designed, developed, reviewed, tested and delivered on time

  • Be a leader in all phases of the Agile software development lifecycle while working with cross-functional team members - Development Leads, Architects, Quality Assurance, DBAs, Product - in a highly collaborative development environment

  • Evangelize newly developed best practices, quality assurance techniques, and automation frameworks with other teams within the organization

  • Responsible for designing and developing re-usable architectures and frameworks for use in black-box test automation

  • Responsible for resolving issues that arise within the automation frameworks

  • Responsible for planning and automating functional and system level tests across diverse platforms using industry standard technologies

  • Responsible for building efficiency and ensuring daily automation runs occur as scheduled

  • Must be able to create automation tests using test plans and cases as requirements

  • Must be able to test open-source solutions (Java-based) running on a Cloud-based infrastructure

  • Continually build the technical skills of colleagues through peer collaboration, mentoring and training


Experience - Qualifications - and Education:



  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field of study



  • Requires at least 7 years of combined Development & Quality Assurance experience in an Enterprise environment

  • Requires experience automating test cases using Selenium

  • Requires experience querying data in relational databases; greatly beneficial to have experience with Big Data in Hadoop or MongoDB

  • Requires experience with RESTful web services that meet industry standard maturity models



  • Requires in-depth knowledge of software development lifecycles and their utilization in software projects

  • Requires solid communication and interpersonal skills; with the ability to work constructively in a collaborative Agile team environment

  • Familiarity with Object Oriented Programming techniques and methodologies in Java

  • Greatly beneficial to have previous experience in the healthcare industry

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience in the Cloud; specifically AWS

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience with Open-Source projects

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
• Responsible for designing and developing the presentation and data layer based on open-source technologies and techniques

  • The candidate will participate in all phases of the Agile software development lifecycle while working with cross-functional team members - Development Leads, Architects, Quality Engineers and DBAs - in a highly collaborative development environment

  • Responsible for implementation of the middleware tier using Java frameworks

  • Responsible for implementation of RESTful web-services in a Service-Oriented Architecture

  • Responsible for implementation of the data access layer that interfaces with relational and NoSQL data stores 

  • Responsible for unit and performance testing software under load to ensure reliability and scalability

  • Adhere to industry best practices for software development

  • Lead the way by developing company standards for software development

  • Continually build the skills of colleagues through peer collaboration and training






Experience - Qualifications - and Education:






  • Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent job related experience

  • Requires at least 3 years development experience in an Enterprise development environment

  • Requires mastery of Object Oriented Programming techniques and methodologies in Java; greatly beneficial to have experience in C#

  • Requires knowledge of web MVC frameworks; greatly beneficial to have experience in Spring Frameworks

  • Requires knowledge of schema design and data access methodologies in both relational databases and NoSQL databases; greatly beneficial to have experience in Hadoop or MongoDB

  • Requires knowledge of software development lifecycles and their utilization in software projects

  • Requires solid communication and interpersonal skills; with the ability to work constructively in a collaborative team environment

  • Requires strong problem solving ability, analytical, and design skills

  • Greatly beneficial to have experience in Responsive web design

  • Greatly beneficial to have experience in RESTful web services meeting industry standard maturity models

  • Greatly beneficial to have previous experience in the healthcare industry

  • Greatly beneficial to have working experience within an Agile environment

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience in the Cloud; specifically AWS

  • Greatly beneficial to have hands-on experience with Open-Source projects

jobs.title: Sr. Software Applications Developer
jobs.content: We are looking to augment our growing team with an experienced lead developer who considers technology a hobby as well as a profession and stays up-to-date on cutting-edge trends and topics accordingly. All employees are eligible for equity in the company as well as the traditional salary and benefits. This position is a FT, in office role, located in Houston Texas.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.content:
Summary:

The primary responsibilities for this position are to: (1) Work in a fast-paced software development team environment. (2) Maintain multiple web-based software applications written in various languages and technologies. (3) Develop new ad-hoc software applications using the entire software development lifecycle for both internal and external stakeholders. (4) Lead software development or process improvement projects as needed. (5) Work closely with vendors to manage enhancements to legacy applications and processes. (6) Continually research and learn new technologies as they become viable and participate in team discussions to develop technical strategy. (7) Cross-train development skills with all members of the team.

This Exempt level position will report to the CQI Manager of Information Technology in the Division of Research & Optimal Patient Care.


Primary Responsibilities:

• Develops software applications to facilitate clinical support activities related to data collection and report generation

• Develops, implements, and supports various ACS NSQIP Websites including new web-based applications such as Resource Portal
• Identifies, develops and maintains value added support features such as online discussion forums, data collector mentoring system, decision support trees, and other training materials

• Provides technical support of the system, maintenance of the ACS NSQIP website, and assists clinical support staff, program staff, statistics staff and member hospitals with technical issues related to website

• Coordinates hardware setup, configuration, and maintenance with ACS Information Technology department

• Participates in discussions with vendors on software development and support related issues as needed

• Other duties as assigned

jobs.title: Senior Dev Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
Sr. DevOps Engineer








Sr. Development Operations Engineer


We are currently looking for an experienced and talented Senior Development Operations (DevOps) Engineer to join our team.  You will be working with our fast-paced software engineering team to deploy and support new and enhanced software applications and services used to support and communicate with our network of kiosks.  You will be responsible for configuration and deployment of software packages to various environments, and for supporting ongoing software operations that enable web, kiosk, and other business critical functions. You will also be collaborating with corporate IT partners to coordinate necessary infrastructure, system administration, networking, database, and information security changes.  Some second shift work is also expected for this position, to support off-hours software operations.









Sr. DevOps Engineer









  • Manual and automated deployment of websites, applications and services to production environments

  • Troubleshooting and providing first tier support for sophisticated applications and services

  • Close coordination and communication with corporate IT teams such as Network Operations Center (NOC) personnel, System Administrators, Network/Firewall engineers, DBAs, Information Security specialists, and other DevOps teams

  • Support of other non-production environments such as staging, development, and QA

  • Maintain and build out our cloud infrastructure operating on Amazon Web Services, making it agile, scalable and secure

  • Provide level 3 on-call, 24x7 phone support, to include off-time upgrades and maintenance

  • Manage, maintain and improve application-level monitors and alerts for website and middle tier services using tools like Splunk, SCOM, Sumologic, LogEntries and Sitescope

  • Respond to alerts and other system monitoring tools as final escalation point of support

  • Monitor, present and analyze transactional vital statistics and application uptime/response time, and recommend environmental or operational changes

  • Troubleshoot origin of errors, website, application servers, network, and databases

  • Recommend and implement best practices for application support in production environments

  • Educate Tier1 and Tier2 teams and other Dev Ops teammates on debugging applications to reduce turnaround time for production issues

  • Troubleshoot production and QA environments encompassing: application configurations, file/directory permissions, performance counter monitoring and analysis

  • Notify stakeholders of system status and provide resolution for environment/application related issues

  • Partner with release and program management teams to setup and maintain testing environments/infrastructure

  • Create and maintain performance counters to monitor applications and collect real time data to share with key stakeholders

  • Partner with QA and development teams to debug and troubleshoot complex application anomalies and server level issues using Debug Diagnostic or other similar tools

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.content: DRUD is looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join its rapidly growing division.
