jobs.title: Engagement Manager
jobs.content:
International Location: London, U.K.

Engagement Managers (EMs) own a book of clients and are responsible for helping those clients unlock the full potential of their business on the AppNexus platform. For each client, EMs will build trusted advisor relationships with senior executives, seize opportunities to unlock value, co-create innovative solutions and drive delivery of the best of AppNexus (Support, Services and Product) to help with client success.

If you're passionate about innovation, client impact, a fast paced work environment and working with the brightest minds then come and help revolutionize how companies buy and sell media in the digital world!

About the job:

  • Client Consulting: Drive deep understanding of a client’s situation – their business and technical challenges, operating environment, capabilities and goals. Leverage knowledge of AppNexus offerings, data driven insights and thorough understanding of the client’s situation to problem solve together and co-create value-add executable solutions
  • Client Account Leadership: Build and maintain enduring and meaningful relationships with clients as their trusted adviser (at-all levels), bring the best of AppNexus – offerings, people and assets – to create client value while expanding our footprint
  • Commercial Account Management: Drive the evolution of commercial relationship including contract negotiation, when necessary.
  • Program Management: Drive execution of identified initiatives using project management best practices: clearly scoped projects, full stakeholder buy-in, mutually agreed success metrics, detailed project plans, resources allocation (internal and external), progress tracking, effective issue resolution and overall communication
  • Knowledge Development: Leverage internal and external experience to help build/improve internal knowledge base on competitive landscape, best practices, playbooks and marketable client success stories. Also, provide inputs to help shape product roadmap and enhance AppNexus Reference Architecture

About your skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree from a top-tier university. Technical degree (BS/MS) or MBA would be a plus
  • Applicable experience may include enterprise technology consulting, business consulting, consultative selling or solutions engineering type roles; technology service delivery; selling consulting projects, contract negotiation, and account development
  • Strong client relationship building
  • Program development / execution skills
  • Ability to work independently but also entrepreneurially and collaboratively with your team
  • Ability to deliver on detail as well as strategy
  • Ability and drive to pick a topic and become a subject matter expert in it
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities
  • Deep understanding of AdTech preferred or a similarly complex industry

More about you:

  • You are passionate about a culture of learning and teaching. You love challenging yourself to constantly improve, and sharing your knowledge to empower others
  • You like to take risks when looking for novel solutions to complex problems. If faced with roadblocks, you continue to reach higher to make greatness happen
  • You care about solving big, systemic problems. You look beyond the surface to understand root causes so that you can build long-term solutions for the whole ecosystem
  • You believe in not only serving customers, but also empowering them by providing knowledge and tools

jobs.title: Web Engineer for Machine Learning company
jobs.content:
Help us solve automated intelligence. Led by professors from Stanford, Berkeley, and MIT, we are focused on moving mature machine learning research into the hands of industry. Located in historic Palo Alto, right next to Stanford campus. This is the perfect position for a Web Engineer to learn and do Machine Learning. Some benefits:



  • Tackle intellectually challenging problems

  • Free lunch, snacks, drinks, and caffeine every day

  • Gym membership with yoga and pilates classes next door

  • Health insurance, including medical and dental

  • Free onsite parking for easy commute, also close to Caltrain

  • Budget for whatever hardware you want

  • Flexible hours

  • Competitive Salary and Equity


Responsibilities



  • Develop core systems and infrastructure supporting the Matroid platform. 

  • Build front-end pages and interaction with backend services.


Minimum Requirements



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • Experience with web applications, Javascript, HTML, CSS


Preferred Qualifications



  • MS in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • Experience with large-scale streaming analytics or machine learning systems.

  • Experience with Node, React, Jade


To apply, please send your resume and introduction to careers@matroid.com

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Join our team and help us operate and optimize an environment with hundreds of machines and a four petabyte (and growing) Hadoop cluster. We write code to make administering that hardware a breeze, and work on projects alongside the rest of the LiveRamp engineering team. Your responsibility will be to do whatever it takes to get the job done -- one day it could be installing racks of hardware, the next day it could be scripting the deployment of a heterogenous environment of dozens of virtual machines.


We run a hybrid colo/EC2 environment with over 400 physical servers and at least as many virtual servers. We are responsible for ensuring high availability and low latency for the billions of HTTP requests we receive every day.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Maintain and grow our existing hardware/software infrastructure. Create tools for managing our massive hardware resources; fight to make our server:sysadmin ratio ridiculously high.

  • Optimize like crazy; squeeze every bit of performance out of our servers.

  • Work closely with developers to solve systems problems. Blur the line between ops and dev.

  • Code, script, and change hardware (disks, laptops, servers, etc.); support network, desktop, and security.

  • Help build a great company.

  • Automate everything! Especially in Amazon where instances appear and disappear constantly.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • B.S. degree in C.S, I.S., Mathematics, or comparable.

  • 3+ years of work experience in DevOps in Linux SysAdmin role, preferably in a fast-paced web application environment.

  • Smart, friendly, gets stuff done.

  • Loves hardware. Probably owns a soldering iron.

  • Lives at the command line.

  • Likes to code. Our ops team is unique; we are part of the development team. Seeking someone with at least two languages, such as Ruby, Bash, Java, Python, Perl.

  • Experience and interest in hardware and systems; you like the nitty-gritty of Linux.

  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, ICMP, SSH, LDAP, DNS, and other low-level network things.

  • Working knowledge of storage, NAS, clustered file systems, RAID.

  • Virtualization experience (Xen, KVM, VMware or OpenVZ).

  • AWS or other Cloud management experience.

  • Intensely driven and proactive.

  • Ability to learn quickly.

  • Great team and business communication skills; project management communication ability.


Desired Additional skills:


    Puppet or other configuration management system experience highly desired, such as Ansible, CFEngine, or Chef.  Hadoop, MapReduce. Experience with petabytes of data

EMPLOYEE BENEFITS:



  • Stock. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future. 

  • Food. Enjoy catered meals, boundless snacks, and the occasional food truck.

  • Fun. We host events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues. 

  • People. Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Health and Saving. Receive the benefits of comprehensive health, dental, vision and disability insurance along with a 401k matching plan.

  • Location. Work in the heart of San Francisco – the best city in the world, and take advantage of our commuter benefits.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content: RiskSense, Inc. is looking for a DevOps Engineer who is capable of building out and maintaining large complex systems. You will have to help design and deploy the infrastructure for both cloud and local systems that may contain dozens of individual nodes. For many of these systems it will not be tractable to maintain them by hand, and you should be able to recognize when this is the case and utilize tools to automate deployment and maintenance of such systems. This critical role must have a strong technical background, business acumen, strong leadership skills, and people-management skills. Analytical thinking also is very important, as this position often involves problem resolution and process development.

jobs.title: QA Lead
jobs.content: The Quality Assurance (QA) Lead will be an active member of the Product Development team and will be responsible for creating, planning, executing and automating test procedures for products that are either built in-house or other commercial products that integrate with our in-house system. The QA Analyst will collaborate with internal technical associates to determine short and long term Automation Strategy. Additionally, the QA shall recommend how to maintain existing environment and ensure end to end testing can be executed for product and software changes.

jobs.title: Scala Software Developer
jobs.content: The Software Developer is responsible for the design, development and release of our organization's web-based applications. Duties include application development and systems integration, spanning front-end, middle tier, and data access components. The company is in the midst of a significant program to revise its core web-based business services delivery automation systems, migrating to a contemporary, open source technology stack. This is a hands-on technical role, providing the opportunity for distributed systems integration and development.

jobs.content: The Software Developer is responsible for the design, development and release of our organization's web-based applications. Duties include application development and systems integration, spanning front-end, middle tier, and data access components. The company is in the midst of a significant program to revise its core web-based business services delivery automation systems, migrating to a contemporary, open source technology stack. This is a hands-on technical role, providing the opportunity for distributed systems integration and development.

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
At Auth0 we care about shipping developer joy while providing zero-friction solutions to make identity easy and secure. If you are passionate about creating amazing user experiences and crafting sustainable components, we are looking for you!


We believe quality software is best built iteratively, with end-to-end ownership of projects, focus on user needs, and right tools. At the moment, across our different projects, we use: React, Redux, Stylus, CSS Modules, Gulp, Webpack, and others, and we routinely evaluate improvements to our stack.


If you feel you want to be part of the challenge of helping developers secure their applications, we are looking for frontend engineers to join our team to work on:



  • Dashboard: Auth0’s Management UI to integrate, secure, and configure your applications

  • Lock: Auth0’s web widget to allow drop-in authentication to any web application.


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate with fellow team members on prioritization, specifications, and progress

  • Create secure, performant, cross-platform browser applications and widgets

  • Evaluate new technologies & techniques to improve overall practices

  • Craft well-documented, reusable, and testable code

jobs.title: Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
For many companies, Auth0 is a core part of their application infrastructure. Our goal every day is to ensure weâre shipping Developer Joy, and one of the most important ways we internalize this is ensure we provide to a service that is highly available for our cloud-based customers.

Auth0 is looking for Infrastructure Engineers to help ensure that our services stay up and running while continuing to rapidly ship software that our customers love. An Infrastructure Engineer is a specialist in creating, deploying and running infrastructure and have a great knowledge of networking, the linux kernel and systems scaling.

We are looking for people that have a passion for building robust infrastructure components that others can reuse and have a track record of working with infrastructure at world scale.

__Responsibilities__

* Manage our infrastructure and provide alerting for teams to detect common problems
* Develop and configure a fault tolerant set of CDNs (Content Delivery Networks) to be used by other teams serving content
* Design and develop the backup and restore procedures for storage services
* Collaborate with development teams to introduce and test updated infrastructure components to be delivered as a service
* Respond to on-call pages caused by failures related to the infrastructure services they own

__Requirements__

* In-depth knowledge of Linux internals
* Salt experience (preferred, but not required if familiar with a complimentary tool)
* Python scripting expertise (our preferred language for scripts)
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills

jobs.title: Production Engineer
jobs.content:
For many companies, Auth0 is a core part of their application infrastructure. Our goal every day is to ensure weâre shipping Developer Joy, and one of the most important ways we internalize this is ensure we provide to a service that is highly available for our cloud-based customers.

Auth0 is looking for Production Engineers to help ensure that our services stay up and running while continuing to rapidly ship software that our customers love. A Production Engineer is part of a crew (or crews) and is responsible for making sure the crew's services/components work reliably.

If you are a developer or a systems engineer with deep knowledge of domains (be it networking, linux kernel, systems scaling, algorithm optimization, etc) and aim to code yourself out of a job by continually automating, then we would like to meet with you.

Responsibilities
  • Setup monitoring, build dashboards and configure alerts for the services they are responsible for
  • Participates and/or directs Incident Management activities associated with crew's services/components
  • Maintain the CI (Continuous Integration) and CD (Continuous Delivery) pipeline for the a set of services they own
  • Implement automated responses to alerts to solve detected issues without need for manual intervention
  • Troubleshoot issues in production that are causing network failures, high latency for a certain operation, etc.

Requirements
  • In-depth knowledge of Linux internals
  • Programming and debugging expertise (node.js is the primary production language)
  • Salt experience (preferred, but not required if familiar with a complimentary tool)
  • Python scripting expertise (our preferred language for scripts)
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills

To apply: jobs+prodengwwr@auth0.com

jobs.title: UX Developer
jobs.content:
At Auth0 we believe that for a product to be truly great it must not only function well but also be easy to use and look beautiful. This philosophy extends into everything we do from our management portal to our documentation. We are looking for somebody who can help us continue to deliver beautiful products.

The UX Developer role will be a member the engineering team that builds our documentation site, the Support Center as well as several upcoming projects. You will be completely responsible for the UX of these sites and will work closely with the Auth0 Design team to align with our company patterns and styles.

The areas you will focus on are:
  • Crafting Great Customer Experiences - You will design and implement (CSS/HTML) interfaces for some of our most important customer interaction points. The tasks will be diverse, but the goal will be the same - creating the best possible experience for the customer. You will work on everything designing better docs pages to creating entirely new experiences to help customers be effective with our product.
  • Collaborate with Core Design Team - Auth0 has a group of top notch designers. You will be a key member of that group. You will work closely with the teamâs responsible for the overall look and feel of Auth0 to ensure everything you create meets our very high standards. An example of this collaboration could be working to add new components to our styleguide or presenting your mockups to the senior UX team for review.
  • Drive the Quality of Our Teamâs Products - You will be responsible for the UX across our entire team's deliverables, but this doesn't mean you will do everything yourself. You will serve as a resource and guide for the engineers on the team to help them deliver great experiences.

Attributes we care about:
  • Detail Oriented - This is probably the most important aspect of this role. You need to care about every detail. Is that div 2 pixels off? Are the fonts spaced perfectly? Every detail matters. We believe that every mistake and every missed opportunity for improvement is an chance we lost to make a customer happy. I cannot stress this enough, if you are not a details person this is not the right role for you.
  • Motivated - You are excited to ship great products. It doesnât matter if you are building something that is used by thousands of customers or one person - you should care about doing the job right.
  • Completionist - You get things done. Getting a feature out to our customers today is better than getting it out tomorrow. You should drive to ship each and every day. You should have a history of shipping.

Skills:
  • Expert level knowledge of CSS. You can make any design happen.
  • Experience working across teams to drive results. You will be working on an engineering team that collaborates with many parts of the company, you need to be able to handle ambiguity while still making things happen.
  • You are just as comfortable in an IDE as you are in Sketch/Photoshop/Illustrator (or whatever design tool you use). You are a designer and a developer.

What to Send:
  • Write a cover letter. If you donât, we probably wonât review your application.
  • Include links to your portfolio or work you have done.

To apply: Apply at: https://jobs.lever.co/auth0/c518c157-35ca-4f6b-88f1-ff49f1b3f03c/apply

jobs.title: Node + React Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you have a passion for building great user experiences? Do you like using the latest and greatest tools to ship and iterate quickly. We are looking for engineers to help us expand our customer success infrastructure team. This team builds a variety of different projects such as the software that runs our documentation site (https://auth0.com/docs) and the Auth0 support center (https://support.auth0.com).
We are looking for somebody who can help us continually improve these apps by adding new and innovative experiences that will help customers learn and use Auth0. We develop our projects using node.js, hapi, express, react, fluxible, and redux. We are Javascript heavy team and building quality features quickly is what drives us.
This role will offer you a lot of freedom. We like engineers who can come up with innovative and creative solutions to problems. This might mean anything from improving the performance or maintainability of some code or to tweaking some UI to give the customer a better experience.

The areas you will focus on are:
  • Building Great Customer Experiences - Everything our team builds is used every day by Auth0 customers. You will be responsible for shipping enhancements to our documentation site. This could be simple things like implementing a redesign of a page or changing some navigation or something more complicated like building an interactive tutorial experience (this is something we want to do).
  • Support Content Contributors - As our team grows we are publishing more and more content. Making improvements to the content publishing process can have a direct impact on our customer's experience. You will work to give our writers and contributors more and better tools to help them create better content. This might mean adding new UI components (via a markdown extension) or writing tests to catch mistakes before they go public.
  • Make Data Driven Improvements - At Auth0 we like to measure everything. You should have a mind for instrumenting code and measuring outcomes. This means testing different UI to see which leads to more desired outcomes and making frequent improvements based on the data. We are always striving to be better and you will drive that in your apps.

Attributes we care about:
  • Motivated - You are excited to build new software. It doesnât matter if it is front-end, backend, tests, or even maybe a build script. You get it done and you do your job well. You like learning new skills and applying your existing skills to make things happen.
  • Completionist - You ship code. Getting a feature out to our customers today is better than getting it out tomorrow. You should drive to ship each and every day. You should have a history of shipping.
  • Detail Oriented - Details matter at Auth0. You will be writing code and building experiences that our customers use every day. You should care about making sure a job is done right and done well.

Technical Skills:
  • Experience with Node.js (hapi/express)
  • Experience building complex web applications - we use React for many projects right now, you donât necessarily have to know React, but you should understand the web and have experience with some framework like Angular, etc.
  • UX skills - we don't expect you to be an expert designer (we have those), but you should be able to use our styleguide (https://styleguide.auth0.com) and create something that looks great. You need to be able to use CSS effectively to implement a nice experience.

To apply: Apply at: https://jobs.lever.co/auth0/28144879-ee27-41bc-ae30-fd3cba1f309a/applyInclude a cover letter (enter it in the textbox) to get noticed. Explain why you want to work at Auth0 and what makes you right for this job.

jobs.name: New Wave Design and Verification, LLC

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.company: New Wave Design and Verification, LLC
jobs.content:
Develop innovative high performance networking products by applying your Linux network programming skills to our high bandwidth, low latency programmable network cards and systems to create solutions to the really hard problems our aerospace, telecommunications, finance and big data clients bring to us to solve.


Work closely with our hardware engineers to design, implement, test and support Linux-based software networking products, including network device drivers and applications. Must possess outstanding problem solving and communication skills to collaborate within and across the engineering and project teams, as well as work independently with minimal supervision.


Perform research and development to create roadmaps to improve and broaden our products and technologies. Assist in the generation of quotes and proposals.


Be committed to sound software engineering principles, and ensure that good processes are in place and being followed. Provide recommendations to improve quality and efficiency.

jobs.title: Lead Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring a Lead Software Engineer, who is passionate about technology and education, to lead a team of Engineers in building new features into our Arc video platform. Learn more about Arc here: https://www.canvaslms.com/arc.

Our product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. We highly value innovation, so much so that we have quarterly Hackweeks.  A week each quarter to work on relevant pet projects and features.

Most of our work is open source, even our primary product (Canvas). Check us out on Github: www.github.com/instructure.




This position is based in Seattle, WA. 



Our Seattle office is located downtown in the Westlake Center, 1601 5th Avenue.




WHAT WE DO:




    • We are full stack engineers with experience building web scale services in a loosely coupled but highly integrated system, as well as developing web scale single-page web apps with modern web technology.

    • We are a mixed stack and polyglot team with a deep commitment to quality and to using the right tech for each problem we solve.

    • We use Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, Node.js, Go, PostgreSQL, Linux, and our platform runs on AWS.

jobs.title: Senior Android Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring engineers who are passionate about technology and education. The product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together.

Most of our work is open source, even our primary product. We are also changing how teachers and students interact, whether in small groups or with tens of thousands of students in one course. Check out our online courses on Canvas Network.



This position is based in Salt Lake City, UT or Chicago, IL. It is not available for remote work. 





HERE'S WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR:




    • 5+ years experience developing native Android Applications. Web experience is a plus. 

    • Ability to mentor and express concepts among cross functional teams clearly and succinctly. 

    • Ability to work independently, collaborate on complex projects, and drive results. 

    • Great attitude and excited about learning.

    • Deep understanding of Java, Design Patterns, and Android architecture

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Web Developer Responsibilities


Drive development of critical parts of our product. Contribute to further development of our AngularJS dashboard, Javascript app platform and app market. Build amazing apps showcased on displays during biggest sports events and shows.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  Cloud Apps / Telecommute OK
jobs.content:
Join a high-powered group of people who create data-visualization software for significant project planners around the world. We are a small, privately-held, profitable company with an enthusiastic customer base.


If you’re tired of startup antics, but want to work for a company that gives you the freedom and flexibility of one, you’ll be pleased to know that we have no outside investors and no debt, so our guiding principle is to grow by doing what is right for our customers. In 2007 we sold the first copies of our OnePager applications, and they have since revolutionized plan communications in industries such as pharmaceuticals, defense, finance, healthcare, manufacturing, and government.


Your job is to be a major contributor on our new cloud app built with ASP.NET, JavaScript, and HTML5 Canvas. We are an agile-methodology company and encourage flexible work arrangements. You can work from your home and join our daily standup meeting by WebEx every morning.


This position is initially contract, with the option to convert to a full-time employee very quickly if there is a mutual fit. This position will be primarily telecommute, with face-to-face meetings as reasonably necessary.

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - Ruby
jobs.content:
Great organizations are made of great people. We are looking for someone who will embrace our mission, vision and values and complete tasks independently, as well as part of the team. This position involves working with the Lead Dev to build onto and strengthen our web-based application. This individual must be passionately committed to our mission of providing the first and best solution for our marketplace and the patients that our application will ultimately serve. We are an organization with the energy and excitement of a startup that is developing a team in a rapidly growing healthcare niche. This position will be responsible for the continued development and support of our base application as well as designing and building new features and capabilities. This job is office-based and not for remote only candidates. This individual will report directly to the Lead Dev and be involved daily in all decisions for the application’s design and deployment.


JOB DUTIES:



  • Develop backend and fronted applications using test-driven development techniques

  • Leverage software design best practices to craft well-written, flexible code

  • Work effectively both independently and collaboratively

  • Learn and understand the Infusion Center healthcare model and its users

  • Be an awesome addition to our development team in accordance with our organization’s values and culture

jobs.title: Junior Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
Role Summary:


Our multi-award winning SMS marketing platform is trusted by brands including Volkswagen, Surfers Against Sewage and Uber; and our API allows our customers to integrate SMS with Eventbrite, Zendesk and Zapier as well as many others, allowing customers to add their own integrations.


We are looking for someone who will be involved in the development of all aspects of our powerful web application, including automating the provision of our infrastructure, designing database models, building APIs and server code (primarily in PHP), as well as writing front-end HTML, CSS and JavaScript.


The role offers excellent opportunities for growth, so our ideal candidate will always be seeking to improve their knowledge and skills, and we’ll support that by sending you to conferences and providing access to relevant training.  We are a distributed agile team operating on 2-week sprints with a strong focus on testing, so the ideal candidate has great communication skills and takes ownership of code and development. 


You will report directly to FireText’s Chief Technology Officer and company directors and we are happy for you to be based at either of our offices, Reigate, Surrey or Penryn, Cornwall; remote working (UK based) may be considered for the right candidate too.


The role will involve some travel to our office locations.


If you're a graduate or an engineer with web development experience looking to further your skills, apply now!


Example Duties: 



  • Development of new features, and maintenance of existing applications

  • Work with the team to design, program, and deliver software solutions using a variety of technologies and programming languages

  • Troubleshoot and fix operational issues as they arise

  • Continuous improvement of the systems and codebase

  • Ad-hoc internal support of operations

jobs.title: Commercial Buildings Software Developer
jobs.content:
Requisition #R1477


You will work within a tightly integrated, multidisciplinary software development team to create and deploy client/server and cloud-based software solutions for the built environment. Product stakeholders include the Department of Energy, California Energy Commission, investor and publicly owned utilities, regional energy organizations, third-party software developers, architects, engineers, and building owners. The successful candidate will be adept at executing complex software integration tasks, but also communicating effectively with teammates and stakeholders. This position requires California residency via remote assignment with periodic travel for in-person collaboration and stakeholder engagements. The successful candidate is proficient at using collaborative development tools and process to facilitate team coding or production-quality software solutions that meet or clients’ needs for cost-effective analysis and design of highly efficient buildings.

jobs.title: Groovy/Grails Developer
jobs.content:
Background


Why consider this opportunity?  For starters, this company was founded 14 years ago by a software developer.  Now the CEO, he understands and appreciates developers.  Each team member is given a private office, in an optimum working environment and treated with respect.  The company’s products are successful internationally, and the company has never needed a dime of investment capital.  Major re-architecture and new development goals have created a need for an excellent developer to help design and develop their next generation SaaS Communications Management Software. Located near LAX, you will enjoy the caliber of the team, the latest technologies and tools, excellent compensation and benefits, matching 401K and most importantly, an ability to influence the product.


Job Scope


Strong candidates will have deep experience in Java, Spring, and MySQL, ideally with some work history in Akka and Groovy/Grails (though this is not required). S/he participates throughout the design, development, coding, testing, and debugging stages in agile development environment.  S/he works within a team to understand problems with software and develops specifications to resolve them. Candidate should be competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications programming activities.   This position requires an individual who is able to produce well-written, well-documented, high-quality, fast code.  Excellent verbal and written English communication skills are a must.


Compensation and Benefits



  • Above market compensation

  • 401K with employer matching and immediate vesting

  • Health, Dental, Vision, Disability, & Life Insurance

  • Education Benefits

  • Private office and covered parking

  • Unlimited snacks and beverages with weekly catered meals

jobs.title: Bluetooth Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Bluetooth Software Engineer


SHFF is seeking an experienced Bluetooth engineer to support development of our consumer products with BLE connectivity and help ready them for final production.


Responsibilities



  • Handle all BLE design, certification, and production support for the product

  • Handle all aspects of the BLE software sub-section

  • Planning, designing and implementing system hardware and embedded firmware

  • Review and optimize existing firmware and make ready for production

  • Work with Quality Assurance to address defects and issues

jobs.title: VP of Engineering
jobs.content:
MetaCommunications is looking for a Vice President of Engineering to lead a world-class development team competing for the top spot in a “hot” space. We’re relentlessly innovating while building an incredible company filled with smart, creative, hard-working people who want to make a difference. We are growing fast and have outgrown the single “CTO / VP of Engineering” role.



As Meta’s VP of Engineering, you’ll be at the helm of our software engineering and product team that is responsible for designing, developing and validating our award-winning enterprise and prosumer cloud-based software products. You will be a part of our executive team and will work alongside our globally renowned CTO to run the team on a day to day basis. You’ll start with a large team of direct reports, grow and hire talent as needed to help scale, establish new & improve existing processes, build upon our strong engineering culture and lead the team to deliver beautiful software that will dominate the market. You will be unlikely to have time to “get your hands dirty” with the actual code, but you will be talking product and leading the charge to solve hard technical, architectural, process and logistical problems on a daily basis.



You'll also be responsible for collaborating with all our other teams in innovating product direction and coordinating the implementation of that direction.



The ideal candidate is a great manager and a team builder, has a keen engineering mindset and excellent communication skills, and is a tenacious problem solver with a proven track record in a similar high paced, high performance startup-like environment. Your ultimate job will be to build the absolute best engineering team and fix the issues that are getting in the way of its success.



What you'll be doing



  • Inspire, lead and grow an outstanding team of software engineers

  • Continue to inspire and develop a customer-centric culture of excellence

  • Design and improve engineering and project management processes, practices and standards

  • Work with the executive team and the product owners to build, maintain and execute product roadmaps

  • Continuously work to improve product quality and foster a culture of strong engineering design

  • Manage to budget targets and work with the executive team and the product owners to optimize R&D investment in the next generation of products

  • Manage product and project milestones, progress and issues

  • Collect, analyze, and report performance metrics to stakeholders

  • Collaborate with leadership to build a world-class engineering organization

  • Work with CTO, UX team and product owners to ship beautiful and functional products


What we're looking for



  • 5+ years as an engineering lead or design engineer

  • 3+ years of software engineering management

  • 3+ years of “in the trenches” startup experience or working with a small team (<30)

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent

  • Hands-on engineering experience with modern software stacks

  • Strong command of software engineering principles, design, and process

  • Demonstrated technical project management skills

  • Demonstrated product management experience

  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment



About MetaCommunications


MetaCommunications develops workflow and collaborative productivity solutions that help marketing, creative design, packaging and prepress workgroups around the world be more productive. MetaCommunications has over 1000 business customers including 3M, Anixter, Allstate Insurance, Bath & Body Works, Bon-Ton, Bridgestone, Crate & Barrel, Diageo, Eddie Bauer, Fox Sports, Mead Johnson Nutrition, Menasha, Merck, National Geographic, Pfizer, Staples, Sony, TJX, Talbots, United Nations, USA Today, Village Roadshow, Wilton, Yamaha, Younkers, and more.

We don't discriminate against employees or applicants based on race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. If you have a disability, please let us know if there's anything we can do to make the interview process better for you; we're happy to accommodate. jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Intoximeters is currently looking for a DevOps Engineer to build and maintain the infrastructure for our customer-facing applications. Our environment is completely cloud-based, running on AWS and GCE.


Responsibilities include:



  • Deploying, configuring, and managing AWS/GCE services (EC2, S3, Route53, etc.)

  • Deploying, configuring, and managing cloud-based Linux servers and their applications.

  • Developing plans for infrastructure improvements.

  • Working closely with the team on upcoming features.

  • Maintaining the current levels of reliability, monitoring and automation.

  • Collecting and presenting metrics on system performance.

  • Managing system security and credential administration.

  • Responding to system alerts and resolving potentially complex systems issues.


Candidates should enjoy learning about new technology and value system reliability and automation. Other qualifications include:



  • Experience with Amazon Web Services and/or Google Compute Engine

  • A strong background in Linux systems administration, cloud computing, networking, and scripting.

  • Experience with at least one configuration management system (preferably Chef).

  • The ability to write clean, reliable, maintainable code in Ruby and/or other languages.

  • Linux/Unix shell scripting

  • Familiarity with several of the following:

    • Docker

    • Kubernetes

    • Nginx

    • PostgreSQL

    • Sensu

    • Jenkins

    • Elasticsearch

    • Kibana

    • Heka

    • Graphite




Team members are provided with a MacBook Pro and a generous benefit package including 401(k) and profit sharing; medical insurance; and tuition reimbursement. If you are interested, please email the hiring manager at jobs@intoxitrack.net

Mattel is committed to developing employees and supporting their career goals, helping them GROW with a host of meaningful experiences and learning opportunities. And by promoting a culture of BALANCE that emphasizes working passionately and taking time to play often, we are proud of how our employees LEAD by example in all that they do!


Fuhu Inc., now a division of Mattel, is the leading designer, seller and innovator of “thoughtful” consumer products and services for children and families.  Creator of the nabi™ tablet, the world’s first tablet made just for kids, Fuhu provides an ecosystem of hardware, software services, and accessories that provide rich and engaging experiences.



Our Team Lead, Back End Software Developer will:

Enforce processes, utilize technological components and tools used in the software development lifecycle


Design and development software modules

jobs.title: DataOps Engineer
jobs.content:
This is an opportunity to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial company in a quickly changing market.  East Daley Capital is a team of highly motivated professionals focused on using granular financial data as well as fundamental supply and demand data to identify over and under-valued assets in the North American Energy Sector.  We need an enthusiastic, creative and motivated individual to join our team and help make it happen.


East Daley Capital is looking for a DataOps Engineer to help drive innovative solutions to help the business collect, organize, visualize and deliver complex energy and financial data sets.  In this role you will be responsible for helping to develop an end to end process for a state of the art data center.  You will have the responsibility for the design, access, and implementation of East Daley’s extensive database.  To be successful you will need the ability to recognize trends and put puzzles together that are relevant to understanding value creation in the intersection of data sets.

jobs.title: Lead Frontend Engineer
jobs.content:
The position is based in Palo Alto, California where you will be joining Data Theorem’s core team of engineers. The work atmosphere will be very relaxed but your work and contributions will have a tremendous *and* direct impact on the company.


The main responsibility for this position is to work on our customer-facing web portal, which helps mobile application developers understand and fix security and privacy issues found in their mobile Apps by our scanner. We want an engineer who can take the portal to the next level, making it better, faster, and more useful, regardless of the user's (reasonably recent) browser or OS. The portal is the main customer-facing interface of our product, and the better it is, the more security and privacy issues will get fixed within our customers' mobile applications.


Our backend services are running on Google Cloud (mainly Python on App Engine) and our frontend is written in AngularJS. This is a lead role so there is lot of flexibility and opportunity when it comes to choosing the tools and more generally the frontend stack. For example, if there are compelling reasons to do so, we could be convinced to switch away from Angular.

jobs.title: ASP.NET MVC Engineer
jobs.content:

As a team member, you'll be a passionate and unrelenting individual willing to brave the storm of learning. We're a company with assumptions to validate and a product to build, refine and improve. You're expertise and input is what you have to offer.


We believe innovation is a result of collaboration across teams, especially in an industry like ours. As such, this position will require flexibility, regular coordination and effective communication with the operations, compliance, technology, and marketing teams.


Our team is a diverse yet like minded group of individuals. Our educational background spans pre-med, pre-law, physics, mathematics, computer science, and computer engineering. Our technological background spans Mac, Windows, Linux, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, C#, Android, iOS, and even PHP! Our gaming background ranges from Counter-Strike and Overwatch to foosball and basketball.


The Engineering team works in a semi-private space of our office along side the Product team giving us an easy platform for collaboration and discussion. We run Agile with two-week sprints.


You can find more about the engineering team at engineering.gopangea.com. You can learn more about our tech stack at engineering.gopangea.com/stack.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:

At ZestFinance, we work with a great deal of enthusiasm and energy along with a social conscience and passion for leveraging data and technology to transform financial services as we know it.


Responsibilities

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Who is Return Path?


Return Path is a global Data Solutions Provider that helps the world’s leading companies promote and protect their brands. Every minute of every day, our clients and partners trust our data and insights to help them build closer, safer, and smarter relationships with their customers. Our unique and proprietary data platform, SaaS products, and professional services allow our customers to generate more revenue and engagement from their marketing campaigns, protect their brands and their consumers from fraud, better understand competitors’ strategies and performance, and gain unparalleled insights into the behavior of millions of consumers.


Once you’re an employee here, this is a place where you’ll be challenged, inspired, rewarded, and transformed.


_________________________________________________________________


The Impact You’ll Have at Return Path


At Return Path, “Big Data” is a big deal! We’re swimming in data, terabytes of it, and we need a few smart, versatile software engineers to help us solve the most pressing challenges in the email industry. For example, we process data from 100+ million email messages every day, and build useful products powered by all that data. If you love solving complex problems in a simple way, have solid programming skills and are passionate about achieving meaningful business results, then you may be the right fit as a Software Engineer at Return Path.


As a Software Engineer here, you will be working alongside other dedicated and passionate engineers, product managers and data analysts, all focused on accomplishing big goals, like stopping spam and ending phishing.  While you don’t need a fancy degree to work here, you do need to embrace learning and continuous improvement, have a strong technical skill set, and favor simple solutions over complex ones. The people we hire are pragmatic, versatile, data-driven and self-directed.


We believe that different perspectives and approaches contribute to a stronger team, so even if you don’t match all of the below, if you’re curious and willing to learn, we’d still love to talk to you.

What does it take to be successful in this role?



  • Practical and professional software development experience

  • Expert in at least one modern programming language (Java, Python, PHP or Go)

  • Strong front-end experience with JavaScript

  • Strong experience building and maintaining RESTful APIs

  • Experience or strong curiosity with Docker

  • Understanding of secure coding concepts, common vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10, etc…), and how to properly mitigate them

  • Curiosity, a passion for learning and a can-do attitude!

  • You’re comfortable owning a project, working with colleagues, and drawing upon skills and teamwork to get the job done.

  • You're energized by solving real problems for real people

  • You excel working in an Agile environment


Nice to haves:



  • Experience with AngularJS, ReactJS and ECMAScript 6 and 7

  • Experience deploying to and working with Amazon Web Services (EC2, RDS, Redshift, EMR, etc)

  • Knowledge of email technology, e.g. ARF, DKIM, MIME


In addition to the above, you must be a good fit at Return Path. To be successful here, you must demonstrate Personal/Professional Growth, Professionalism, Execution, andStrategic Thinking; have a Positive Impact and a great sense of humor.  


People First


At Return Path, we are building an extraordinary company that helps people and businesses communicate more reliably, effectively, and securely. We put people first, do the right thing, and succeed together.


We have a strong belief that our people are the most important part of our business. We incorporate this philosophy into our practices and we live it every day. This means we have generous traditional benefits and take a lot of time to focus on quality management and leadership development. We also strive to ensure each person in the company is in the right job, knows how his or her job contributes to the overall company mission, and has a clear sense of career growth and direction. We have great employee retention over the years because people love coming to work here and really feel like they're part of something special.


Do the Right Thing


The Return Path experience is a two-way exchange.  We expect you to give us your best every day, and you can expect the same from us. In exchange for your talent, your energy, and your unique contributions, we will strive to give you what you need to live a balanced, healthy life. This means more than competitive pay and benefits—it means offering the freedom and flexibility to create your ideal experience inside and outside the office.



For more information visit www.returnpath.com

jobs.title: E-Commerce Web Developer
jobs.content:
About the Position


SparkFun is looking for a Senior Web Developer to help lead the next phase of development on it’s E-Commerce platform. This will include critical design review of current implementation and architecture as well as building additional tools for internal and customer use. The developer will work closely with the marketing team to ensure the system is flexible and extensible as well as meeting the needs of our customers. The developer will focus on creating flexible, modular solutions designed around best practices.


The ideal candidate will need to be comfortable in PHP and modern JavaScript as well as working with relational databases such as Postgres. They should be comfortable redesigning major features, helping architect new functionality and leading small teams of developers. The developer will be comfortable building out and integrating 3rd party tools through REST APIs. They will be working with internal customers, helping to deliver production code through our development life cycle.


About the Department


SparkFun’s Software Development & Information Technology department is responsible for the continuous development of all SparkFun web properties. This includes the primary ecommerce website (sparkfun.com) and the primary educational resources website (learn.sparkfun.com). Also included is Sparkle, SparkFun’s custom-built ERP system which is used to manage all content on the aforementioned web properties as well as order processing, customer management, shipping, inventory controls, manufacturing, etc. SparkFun’s latest Open Source Software project is Phant. Phant powers data.sparkfun.com which is our open source solution to Internet of Things (IoT) data hosting.


Where possible (which is most everywhere) open source languages and tools are used and where possible code developed by SparkFun IT is given back to the community as open sourced libraries.


If you like the sound of these programs and want to help modify, update and create new open source software to help power the future of the exciting space, this team is your home.

jobs.title: Web-based Collaborative Geographic Information Systems Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
About:


The Landscape Spatial Analytics section is part of the Habitat Science Division in the Washington Dept. of Fish & Wildlife. This group has created a successful program mapping land-cover change through a mixture of machine-learning methods, automating spatial processing and innovative user-interface optimization for accuracy assessment. Current projects seek to complement their successful remote sensing approach with crowd source data and collaborative knowledge capture tools. 


You'll work in the Habitat Science division of the Washington Dept. of Fish and Wildlife on developing a collaborative GIS system to help the public and professionals track multiple natural resource issues in an online dataservice. The Geospatial Land Activities Dataservice will combine the data binding magic of angularjs and d3 with custom mapping tools developed through the ESRI javascript api. You'll develop a set of tools to facilitate mapping and discussion about ecosystem restoration projects, wetlands, shoreline armoring and more that will grow to help the Dept. of Fish & Wildlife, state and federal agencies, tribal nations, NGOs and the citizens of Washington track and achieve a sustainable future for the area we have come to know and love. You'll be a key player in a small team helping craft a new set of tools to bring increased transparency and effectiveness to natural resource management in one of the nations most important estuary complexes, Puget Sound.


As a member of our team you will have the opportunity to bring your creative skills to bear on solving real world problems. As an innovative team we encourage continuous learning and you'll have access to Lynda.com and time to delve into new topics as we grow and build. You can even help us get our Joel test score up to 12!

jobs.title: SQL Server Developer / DBA
jobs.content:
NCCPA is seeking an experienced SQL Server Developer / DBA to join their IT team.


You will wear a number of different hats in this role. You'll be responsible for the operations of NCCPA's on-prem and on-cloud SQL Server databases. That includes maintenance plans, disaster recovery, scheduled and on-demand backups, SQL Agent job scheduling and monitoring and more. In addition, you'll spend a good portion of your time doing support work (ad-hoc reporting and analysis, data updates) and project work (data modeling, data migrations, performance tuning).


You'll work with a great IT team supporting both internally developed apps and third party apps. You'll work with SQL Server 2016, SQL Server 2012, and SQL Azure. You'll have whatever tools you need to get the job done. You'll be a key member of the team and will be involved in architectural decisions, strategy, security, vendor selection, and more.

jobs.title: Full Stack .Net Developer

Typically, each developer owns an entire user story and sometimes an entire project. You will work in all layers from front-end to back-end. You will do more than just write code though. Developers are valued for their input at all phases of a project. Be prepared to discuss requirements with project stakeholders and analysts. Enjoy showing off your work during project review meetings. Help guide the direction of the development team by mentoring other developers, introducing your favorite tools, and speaking your mind on process and architecture.

jobs.title: Conversion Copywriter
jobs.content:
Student Loan Hero (SLH) combines financial education with easy-to-use tools to help the millions of Americans living with student loan debt to manage their student loans smarter.

Since 2012, Student Loan Hero has helped more than 80,000 borrowers to manage and eliminate over $1.7 billion in student loan debt. Each year, it helps more than one million people become financially healthy.

For both current and former students who want to manage their loans in line within their own budget, Student Loan Hero offers free loan calculators, unbiased personalized advice, and repayment plans, all with a user-friendly interface and dashboard.

What does the Conversion Copywriter do?

The Conversion Copywriter's task is to take web pages, emails, and other content and create copy that improves conversion rates and gets results.

Key skills include:

  • Making boring topics (like student loans and personal finance) interesting and fun.
  • Understanding psychology and human behavior and why people think and act the way they do.
  • Finding the right words to educate, inspire, and motivate users to take action.
  • Create clear and engaging copy that's honest and helpful (and not hype).
  • Ability to find weak spots in web and email copy and creating new copy to improve those weaknesses.
  • A focus on results -- you're not merely creating new copy and calling it a day. Instead, you're focused on making sure what you produce gets the desired results.

The ideal candidate for this position should have an entrepreneurial mind-set and be ready to take on and initiate new projects as he or she sees the need arise.

Whatâs it like to work on the Student Loan Hero team?

Student Loan Hero is a rapidly-growing and fully remote team. We have team members all over the world, in cities including NYC, Austin, Portland, Santiago, and St. Petersburg.

Since weâre literally all over the map, communication using Slack, Gmail, Basecamp, Google Hangouts, and other tools is key for us. Don't worryâyou won't be alone. We communicate regularly throughout the day.

In our small group, each team member uses highly specialized skills while working on a variety of projects. We enjoy giving our team members autonomy to do the work that interests them. Weâre focused on the output of each team member, not putting in long hours.
Weâre always open to new ways to create better content and make Student Loan Hero better for student loan borrowers, and we want to hear new ideas from you. A large part of our culture and values is transparency. We believe that team members should collaborate and communicate, not compete or engage in office politics.

At the same time, we like to make work as much fun as possible. We want everyone on our team to grow both personally and professionally, which is why we offer wellness and educational bonuses, as well as several other great perks.
Above all, weâre each proud to work on solving meaningful problems and to impact lives every day. Whether itâs authoring a blogpost read by thousands of borrowers or answering a one-on-one customer support question, we value that working for Student Loan Hero makes a positive impact.

To apply: Visit here: https://student-loan-hero.workable.com/jobs/313959 and hit "Apply for this job" at the bottom of the page.

jobs.title: PR Specialist -- Full Time, Remote
jobs.content:
Description
Student Loan Hero (SLH) combines financial education with easy-to-use tools to help the millions of Americans living with student loan debt to manage their student loans smarter.

Since 2012, Student Loan Hero has helped more than 80,000 borrowers to manage and eliminate over $1.7 billion in student loan debt. Each year, it helps more than one million people become financially healthy.

For both current and former students who want to manage their loans in line within their own budget, Student Loan Hero offers free loan calculators, unbiased personalized advice, and repayment plans, all with a user-friendly interface and dashboard.

What Does The PR Specialist Do? 
Our efforts have already landed us on some awesome publications, including Lifehacker, Vice, Forbes, Mic, and CNBC. Now, we're looking to expand our outreach team by bringing on a new PR Specialist to work his or her magic on showcasing our brand to new audiences and marketing SLH as a leader in the student loan and Millennial personal finance space.
The PR Specialist will work with the community outreach team and be responsible for strategizing and executing earned media strategy for Student Loan Hero. He or she will oversee the entire process including: identifying potential story/media opportunities, developing/maintaining relationships with publishers, working internally to receive/develop outreach materials, and earning media placements.

Success in this role will require prior experience in securing top-tier placements on a regular basis as well as the ability to identify news trends and jump on these opportunities before the end of those respective new cycles. The ideal candidate will need to demonstrate both creative and strategic thinking.

What's It Like To Work For the SLH Team?
Student Loan Hero is a fully remote team. We have team members all over the world, in cities including NYC, Austin, Portland, Santiago, and St. Petersburg.
Since weâre literally all over the map, communication using Slack, Gmail, Basecamp, Google Hangouts, and other tools is key for us. Don't worryâyou won't be alone. We communicate regularly throughout the day.

In our small group, each team member uses highly specialized skills while working on a variety of projects. We enjoy giving our team members autonomy to do the work that interests them. Weâre focused on the output of each team member, not putting in long hours.

Weâre always open to new ways to create better content and make Student Loan Hero better for student loan borrowers, and we want to hear new ideas from you. A large part of our culture and values is transparency. We believe that team members should collaborate and communicate, not compete or engage in office politics.

At the same time, we like to make work as much fun as possible. We want everyone on our team to grow both personally and professionally, which is why we offer wellness and educational bonuses, as well as several other great perks.

Above all, weâre each proud to work on solving meaningful problems and to impact lives every day. Whether itâs authoring a blog post read by thousands of borrowers or answering a one-on-one customer support question, we value that working for Student Loan Hero makes a positive impact.

Required
  • 2+ years experience in media relations
  • Experience in securing top-tier media placements on a regular basis
  • MUST provide examples of secured media placements

Preferred
  • Experience in working for a PR firm
  • Demonstrated interest in working with startups
  • Experience in working in the personal finance space
  • Experience in securing syndication partnerships with top-tier sites
  • Bachelorâs degree in PR, communications, marketing, etc.

Benefits 
  • Competitive salary: Based on experience and location
  • Equity: 0.05â0.15% in vested company ownership
  • Vacation: Unlimited
  • Flexible hours: Work when youâre most productive
  • Work remotely: Work from wherever you want in the world (Costa Rica, anyone?)
  • New equipment: Weâll hook you up with a $2,000 technology stipend to purchase a laptop or whatever helps you work
  • Remote workspace: We'll pay up to $500/month for a remote office space (e.g., co-working space)

jobs.title: Outlook Plugin Developer with RESTful API Integration Experience
jobs.content:
We're looking for a developer with experience in writing VSTO plug-ins in C# for Office 2013+ for Windows 7+. The plug-ins will interact directly with our proprietary Restful API for retrieving and storing user data in our cutting edge, Azure hosted web application.The first plug-in to be developed and the priority for this project is for Microsoft Outlook 2013 or later.

Our ideal developer will have at least 6 years of experience writing performant, efficient code in C# (4.5) that is ready for a production environment; excellent verbal and written communication is a REQUIREMENT.

This position will be the sole developer on this project and will continue development on a the plugin code that already exists but has not yet been released to the public. We will provide annotated mockups that will detail all interaction, as well as access to our API documentation and direct communication with our Chief Architect.

U.S. based candidates only, west coast preferred, ideally located in San Diego.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Microsoft Careers: My job details


Are you looking to add cloud experience to your resume? Are you excited to be a leader in the frontier world of software as service? Then you are looking to be a part of the ASG substrate!


Office 365 is key to Microsoft’s cloud strategy and is the industry leader in hosted productivity suites that includes Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive and more. It is the fastest and more profitable business at Microsoft with more than 100 million enterprise seats and several hundred million consumer accounts. O365 Foundations Engineering team is chartered with building the substrate that drives these intelligent applications.   We run the core infrastructure for Office 365 which is hosted in multiple data centers across the globe.


Office 365 Foundation Engineering is responsible for managing all the hardware, build infrastructure, deployment, active directory, identity and provisioning, secure access, workflow management of tasks, availability monitoring and alerting, visualization and optics and extensibility. We are also responsible for security and compliance because customers trust how we handle their data which is a key differentiator for Microsoft. We build an administrator portal, handle customer support, and maintain live site operations. Teams leverage a mix of custom datacenter technologies, standard Azure technologies and open source technologies.


Office 365 Foundation Engineering is looking for Software Engineers to deliver on the big bets crucial to Office 365’s success. We are looking for software developers that are technically strong, hungry for new challenges, willing to deal with ambiguities and eager to take on larger scope and ownership. We have opportunities in everything from UI to core kernel work and anything in between.   All of our work comes with challenges of big data, large scale and continuous shipping and supporting a mission-critical live service.

jobs.title: Front-End Web Developer

The University of Wisconsin-Madison’s Division of Information Technology (DoIT) is looking for a full-time front-end developer to join our team.



Your Role:


Are you excited about front-end web technologies and UI/UX?  Are you looking for an opportunity to continue learning and be part of dynamic team?  We’re looking for an experienced front-end developer to be the next member of our growing team!


The work we do is varied and challenging, so you will need the tenacity to take on our increasing list of development projects that benefit students, faculty, and staff at UW-Madison and beyond.   You’ll have an opportunity to learn while you work as part of a team to help customers to design, build, and deploy web content.  Additional responsibilities will include working on front-end development tasks associated with application development projects.


You’ll enjoy robust benefits such as the State of Wisconsin Benefits Package, a beautiful Campus Setting and a competitive salary.

jobs.title: Assistant Controller
jobs.content:
HomeSuite is on a mission to change the way people live. We want to make leasing a property as easy as booking a hotel. Finding housing today is a nightmare: unlike hotels and vacation rentals, the real estate industry is entirely offline. We want to bring rentals and apartments to people with a simple click. From search to signing the lease, and even on move out day, we are committed throughout the entire rental process.

This revolutionary product is driving explosive growth and we are backed by top tier VCs (Foundation Capital, Battery Ventures, Bessemer Venture Partners and Google Ventures). Our leadership team is obsessed with enabling HomeSuite to achieve its potential as a massive company and building a strong, values-based culture that is visionary, performance-oriented, collaborative, and customer-centric. Through our hard work and passion, we believe we can create a new industry of on-demand housing.

If you want to learn a little bit more about what it's like to work out HomeSuite check out profile on The Muse here.

Responsibilities:

  • Establish and manage accounting policies, everything from revenue recognition, daily cash reconciliation, AR, AP
  • Establishing a rigorous month-end and year-end close processes (Complete close by 10 business days)
  • Manage day-to- day accounting activities and monthly financial close process: journal entries, reconciliation and financial reports
  • Work closely with Operations to create and maintain invoices in HomeSuite payment system
  • Coordinate with Care on past due collections and payments
  • Hire, train and supervise additional accounting resources as required, function includes GL, AP, AR and payroll
  • Responsible for monthly sales commission calculation and reporting
  • Identify opportunities for improvements to business processes; assist in development and implementation of new procedures
  • Prepare ad hoc reports for senior level management
  • Manage US, State and local tax filings

Requirements:

  • Bachelors in Accounting or Finance, Big 4 experience and/or CPA strongly preferred.
  • 4+ years of relevant experience in public accounting
  • 3+ years of industry accounting experience
  • Experience with Stripe payment system is strongly preferred
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Management experience of accounting staff is strongly preferred
  • Assist in the development, implementation, and interpretation of goals, policies, and procedures relating to accounting, financial management and reporting
  • Strong GAAP understanding and experience is required.

Other Desirable Skills and Experience:

  • Ability to work independently with minimum supervision as well as in a team-based environment
  • Supervisory, project management or other similar experience leading process improvement initiatives
  • Experience documenting process/ procedures

WHY US?

We are passionate about our mission and our marketplace, and everything we do helps drive us to our goal of creating on-demand housing. We are also conveniently located in San Francisco; a city with great nightlife, beautiful outdoors, and world-class culture right at your fingertips. Come join the team that is bringing the real estate industry online. We need your help  to make leasing a property easy and efficient.

Perks/Benefits:
-Fully Subsidized healthcare (Medical, Dental, Vision)
-Generous Stock Options
-Unlimited PTO
-$100 commuter benefits towards any form of transportation
-HomeSuite credits 
-Snack filled kitchen

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Developers
jobs.content:
We're disrupting the real estate investor market by scaling out in whole new way, and are building a new platform to grow the flip and rental investment market.  We’re providing loans to home flippers at industry leading rates nationwide, growing quickly, and want to make a big web tech play in that field.


We have a small growing company that’s using leading edge tech and products and making a difference in our markets.  We’re looking for solid Ruby Developers, Senior Devs, and Lead Devs to join the team.


Compensation wise we provide PTO, medical benefits, and are offering stock ownership in the projects themselves.


In our Ruby Developer role, we’re looking for:



  • Great coders with a passion for rapid quality development

  • Demonstrates clear understanding of the field by simply explaining complex concepts

  • Multi-project experience with Ruby on Rails, Bootstrap UI, generators, etc

  • Is able to spin up a new Rails project from the ground up quickly and smoothly

  • Takes a test-first approach with a preference for their favorite tools, quality systems, etc

  • A plus for experience with: Slim, Handlebars, a wide variety of gems, open source project contributions, your own personal coding projects, Postgres, MongoDB, NodeJS, AngularJS, ReactJS, variety of REST or JSON RPC APIs,


In our Lead Devs, we’re also looking for someone to:



  • Take complete ownership over one of our project areas

  • Heading up development

  • Be the senior coding developer on the project

  • Own the IT hosting components

  • Create the feature specs (mockups, workflows, features, etc)

  • Set the technical direction and architecture

  • Be SCRUM/KanBan master, tracking team velocity, handle work items, bug triage, internal customer requests, etc

  • Sharp understanding of pros and cons of various gems, APIs, and libraries

  • Bring in the latest technologies, like AngularJS, NodeJS, ReactJS, etc

  • Experience building REST APIs, including beautiful documentation

  • Oversee the user experience and interface

  • Put into place best practices around testing and code quality

  • And potentially move into a team manager role, hiring the team, leading the team, and providing technical direction


These roles report to the VP of Development, work with the business owners to define new features (mockups, specs, user stories, etc), and make it all happen!


Do you enjoy a great map?  Like exploring Ruby voodoo but keep it sane?  Like building new sites from the ground up?  Optimizing workflow?  Enjoy bringing in the latest tech into a project?  Want to get in on a young company growing fast?  Mentor others?  Write kickass code?  Then this may be just the right role for you.


Keywords: ruby, rails, ruby on rails, devise, cancan, heroku, postgres, mysql, angular, angularjs, node, nodejs, project management, SCRUM, agile, kanban, bootstrap, reactjs


This is a full time position at our Irving TX location at 4600 Fuller Dr 75038.  You must have clearance to work full-time without additional sponsorship needed.  And we provide the latest in tech to our team.


ManPow LLC
New Western Acquisitions, Sherman Bridge Lending, and MoneyBug
Noah Coad, VP of Development, noah.coad@manpow.com

jobs.title: Research Software Engineer
jobs.content:
RAND is seeking an experienced software engineer with particular focus on supporting our multidisciplinary software development activities. 


The position requires eliciting requirements from users, designing software products with researchers, implementing designs in code, and iterating with users and researchers to ensure functional and quality requirements are always met.


Candidate will work on project teams of research staff and domain experts and will often be the sole software engineer on the project.  Some projects will involve multiple software developers so ability to work effectively with them is key.


Technical needs will vary by project so the candidate must be a well-rounded generalist able to develop solutions in MORE THAN ONE of the following application paradigms:  desktop, web, mobile, database, modelling & simulation, machine learning, statistical analysis, and visualization. 


Qualifications


Key functions: 



  • Developing in part or in whole interactive applications including the graphical user interface to back end server components and databases

  • Developing applications or scripts to data mine, analyze, and visualize data sets

  • Briefing others on software design, software development progress, and software tool results

  • Written documentation of software and software tool results for inclusion in customer briefings and RAND publications


Technical requirements: 



  • Have working knowledge of object oriented analysis and design

  • Have expertise in Java, Python, or C++

  • Have some expertise with at least one language that can be used  for web programming such as Ruby, Node, PHP, or JavaScript

  • Have some expertise with at least one flavor of SQL Database such as MySQL, SQL Server, or PostgreSQL

  • Experience with simulation/model development

  • Ability  to prototype rapidly

  • Have at least tinkered with a scientific programming package like R or Matlab

  • Have an understanding of MVC frameworks

  • Have used some flavor of version control

  • Have used an IDE for coding and debugging


 Technical preferences:



  • Have explored a new technology on your own for no other reason than intellectual curiosity and challenge

  • Experience working in a research environment or applied R&D laboratory is preferred


Education Requirements


BA/BS required, MA/MS preferred, preferably in Computer Science or highly related field such as Information Systems, Computer Engineering, etc.


Experience


1 year minimum, 5 or more years preferred

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Applications
jobs.content:
SO WHAT'S THIS JOB ABOUT?


To be successful in this role you must be the kind of software engineer who can turn their hand to both server-side and browser-side code and understand the ins and outs of each - a person who is looking to play with some cool technology and build some great products. Whether you got your start with a Computer Science degree, attending a boot camp, or by writing code on the side, you know what it is to write code and you love doing it. 


There's a great deal of collaboration with a diverse team (which often leads to having fun) at Jellyvision. You'll be working on a bunch of different (but related) projects at any given time. Development is a team effort at Jellyvision, and all our development teams use Scrum, which means every day involves working with product owners, Scrum Masters, QA, DevOps, and the users we have right here in the building.


Jellyvision isn’t just made up of engineers—we’re also writers, project managers, producers, sales folks—you get the idea. In other words, you’ll be talking to a lot of people without a strong technical background, so you will need to demonstrate a respect for smart people who aren't engineers and are able to teach them and listen to them so we can all share our successes.


On a day-to-day basis, you'll be working on our products and on the tools that help the rest of the company build those products. You'll add features, fix bugs (what, bugs?! never!), test the stuff you built, and be involved in designing the next features and tools coming down the line.


"SENIOR" CAN MEAN DIFFERENT THINGS...WHAT DOES SENIOR MEAN TO JELLYVISION?

If you’re the seasoned engineer for us, you’ve got a few years under your belt, have worked on some large projects, and have guided your team through said projects.


You should have solid experience with the ecosystems of JavaScript and Ruby; modern JavaScript build pipeline, including task runners, transpilers, bundling, and so on. You’ve got examples of clean Ruby architecture and transparent data modeling, and can handle writing database queries in SQL, as well as NoSQL tools like CouchDB. You are fearless in the face of old code (Flash, PHP).


Got an eye for style or great UI/UX? Anything else relevant that you think makes you a rockstar senior? Tell us about it!
