jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer at Agora (a subsidiary of Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment), you will be working primarily on our online game services platform called "Hydra Studio”, in addition to some other internal technologies. You will be responsible for managing the infrastructure behind very complex data processing and presentation tools that integrate tightly with some of the industry's biggest game franchises. You will work as part of a highly talented team of producers, engineers, and business specialists to expand the Hydra platform, and ensure an efficient and stable environment for WB Games' catalogue of products.


We are looking for a candidate with the ability to quickly learn new platforms. We use many different technologies within Hydra, and while we don’t expect you to know them all coming in, we need a candidate who can quickly learn and be proficient with them!


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Own automation of the infrastructure platform

  • Work on incorporating Agora Games’ engineering practices into infrastructure operations

  • Write and review code, develop documentation and capacity plans, and debug problems, live, on very complex systems

  • Together with your engineering team, you will share an on-call rotation and be an escalation contact for service incidents

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a Senior Software Engineer at Agora (a subsidiary of Warner Bros.Interactive Entertainment), you will be working primarily on our online game services platform called "Hydra Studio”, in addition to some other internal technologies. You will be responsible for creating complex data processing and presentation tools that integrate tightly with some of the largest franchises in the games industry. You will work as part of a highly talented team of producers, engineers, and business specialists to expand our systems and add value to WB Games' catalogue of products.


We are looking for a candidate with the ability to quickly learn new platforms. We use many different technologies within Hydra, and while we don’t expect you to know them all coming in, we need a candidate who can quickly learn and be proficient with them!

jobs.title: Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
Team Daugherty is in search of an experienced Solutions Architect to join our rapidly growing team. A strong consulting background, exceptional leadership skills and adaptability are all important characteristics for a successful candidate. Possessing excellent communication skills to build strong, trusting relationships with clients and team members is a must! This position must be able to navigate new environments quickly, manage others, proactively mitigate risks, resolve issues and escalate when appropriate.


 As a Solutions Architect you will be responsible for the following:



  • Developing departmental technology solutions, blueprints, roadmaps, etc.

  • Evaluating technologies to develop technology strategies.

  • Working with business units to analyze and capture business needs.

  • Developing architecture designs, processes, standards and guidelines.

  • Aligning technical solutions with business needs.

  • Managing stakeholder relationships.

  • Leading a team of architects, leads and individual contributors.

jobs.title: Senior Backend PHP Developer
jobs.content:
We are By the Pixel, a small and mighty digital agency located in Denver, Colorado. We are looking for a full-time backend developer to join our team of passionate and driven individuals. Our company specializes in high-end web application design and development for all devices.


Some of your responsibilities will include:



  • Database architecture and creation

  • Implementing new application features

  • Design, evaluate, and update object oriented applications

  • Working with members of our team to set the technical direction of our projects, perform code reviews and help define QA test patterns

  • Create and execute unit tests and perform basic systems testing

  • Learn new technologies to continue to evolve your skills as a full stack developer


Architectures, technologies, and practices used:



  • Laravel

  • CodeIgniter

  • RESTful API

  • Angular.js

  • AJAX

  • Git revision control (via GitHub)

  • Continuous integration

  • Test-driven development


If you're interested, please provide the following:



  • A brief description of why you're interested in this job specifically, and why your skills and career path are relevant.  

  • A concise resume, emphasizing your skills as a full stack developer.

  • Real examples of web development work you've done via live sites, Github, Stack Overflow, or blogs.

jobs.title: Opportunity For Quality Assurance Analyst On A Solutions Focused Team
jobs.content:
This position is remote and open to US residents only


At InventoryLab, we are redefining the workflow of thousands of Amazon sellers. Our product allows third party Amazon sellers to source new inventory, list on Amazon, manage inventory, and analyze their business metrics. We are currently focused on growing our customer-driven team to meet increased demand; adding development, consulting, and support staff.


We are searching for a Software Quality Assurance Analyst that can help grow our SaaS business by delivering a consistent experience with our core product while producing fully tested new features. Specifically, we’re looking for someone obsessed with quality improvement. A person who is committed to creating top notch automation for regression and feature testing. We are looking for someone who can assist with development of test strategy while also implementing that strategy.


At InventoryLab, we work in small multidisciplinary teams to plan next steps and give advice, but we all are responsible for making it happen. You will have the freedom, and responsibility, to chart your own course. Working at InventoryLab means choosing your own work location every day, responsible time off, and a full benefits package.


How we get it done:



  • Our focus is on how we can continue to provide an optimal user experience

  • We use Jira for product management, issue reporting, ideology, and documentation

  • We rely on Zephyr for Jira Cloud to deliver high quality products on time

jobs.title: Java Developer
jobs.content:
As a member of our team, you will design and build the next generation of software for Ubiquisoft clients and in-house products.  From initial product concept to production support this position encompasses the full development lifecycle.  In this position you will get experience developing new systems, performing some existing system maintenance, and learning new technologies. Each developer works in a private windowed office at our location in Germantown, TN.


Core Responsibilities

  • Coordinate the development, implementation, installation, development, and operation of systems for various organizations

jobs.title: Customer success engineer - help engineers & developers
jobs.content:
The gist: Help Papertrail make developers, sysadmins, and entrepreneurs happy. 100% online (email and Campfire/Slack text chat), no phone calls.


Papertrail provides log management as a service. We work with tens of thousands of ops-savvy developers, systems engineers, and entrepreneurs, in companies like Heroku, GitHub, Slack. We're part of SolarWinds, which includes Librato and Pingdom. SolarWinds was voted by Forbes as #19 Most Innovative Growth Companies and in 2014 #11 America's Best Small Companies. Startup atmosphere and tools, public company benefits. 


We've grown to need technical customer support. That's where you come in.


Okay, cool. What's involved?



  • Help customers setup and use Papertrail's service via email and text chat.



  • The questions are about a wide range of topics like Linux, syslog, Web framework logging, Ruby, Rails, PHP, REST/JSON, Python, and Django, plus non-technical topics. You almost certainly won't know about all of these.



  • While a working knowledge of Linux is required, Googling to satisfy your own curiosity is a lot more valuable (and hopefully, fun).



  • Be comfortable and personable in email, even when interacting with strangers.



  • Show a passion for devops tools, Web services, and technology in general. We're doing this because we love it.


A few things make this unique...



  • Work remote in the United States or the world



  • Do as much beyond customer-facing support as you're interested in



  • Interact with incredibly savvy, passionate customers.

jobs.title: Dayton & Ohio Best Place To Work 2016 -Senior Android Developer
jobs.content:
We are on the hunt for an innovative and critical thinker to join our Mobile Development team at Marxent. This candidate will lead our team on Android development, thus they must have proven experience and knowledge. We’re a down-to-earth company that makes out-of-this-world software and we’ve found that team members who are humble, supportive, have a sense of humor, and enjoy working and collaborating with others make the most successful additions to the Marxent family. The perfect candidate is a ninja in one or two areas and curious about many others.


On an average week you can expect to:



  • Have daily stand-up meetings with to understand what projects are active, what work needs to be completed, roadblocks the team is facing, and high priority items for the day

  • Research new software techniques and stay educated on current tech and modeling techniques


Job Specifications:



  • A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent is preferred

  • 3+ years previous work experience as a mobile developer is desired

  • No travel is required for this position

  • This position is in an open (without cubicles) office facility in Dayton, OH.

jobs.title: Full-time Senior Web/Ruby Developer with some Java experience
jobs.content:
Founded in 2011 and backed by preeminent VCs and successful serial entrepreneurs, TextMaster (www.textmaster.com) disrupts the translation industry by providing the first online marketplace for professional translation services. With TextMaster, clients can now order any kind of translation in any language from qualified translators in just a few clicks, 24h/7, around the globe. To make it short, weâre âuberizingâ a $40bn industry!

Weâre facing rapid growth in 110 countries and are now hiring a talented RoR developer to strengthen our team and keep releasing amazing features that will make our clients super happy.

Your position:

You will join an ambitious development team to help build an amazing online platform while striving to improve your skills. As part of TextMasterâs core development team, you will work on extending and building exciting new features. Most of our code is homemade, so you will have the chance to work on every aspect of a very large and successful online product.

We are looking for highly motivated developers that have extensive experience in Rails and additional interest/skills in Java and file-format processing will be a huge plus.

The position requires a lot of attention to detail and a strong technical expertise. Youâll join a team of very talented developers working in an amazing atmosphere and a very multi-cultural environment. The position is open to full time remote developers (preferably based in Europe for timezone consideration) or to employees in our Belgian (Brussels) or French (Paris) offices. 

Technical environment:

Back-end: Ruby on Rails (Rails 4.x)
Front-end: React / Redux, ES6, SCSS, HTML 5, CSS
3, JQuery, Node.js, etc.
Database: MongoDB, Elastic Search, Redis, Postgres
Infrastructure: Heroku, AWS, Docker, SOA, Micro-Services

Other (we use state of the art products and processes):
  • Testing (TDD): Rspec, Capybara, Selenium
  • Source control: github.com
  • Continuous integration and deployment: Semaphore
  • Code review: Code Climate
  • Monitoring: Newrelic
  • Etc.

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 5 years of similar work experience
  • Perfect command of English (written and spoken)
  • Invoicing structure and proper registration if working remotely or valid work permit in Belgium/France
  • Available full time
  • â¦ and most importantly: positive spirit and high motivation!

To apply: Interested? Please send you application along with the result of the following technical test https://gist.github.com/aponsin/3fcc41e5e538dbb86947Please note that we take this test very seriously and that we are not looking to work with consultancy agency, we want to grow our internal team.

jobs.title: DevOps/ Sr. IT Systems
jobs.content:
Are you a skilled and self-motivated IT systems administrator or systems analyst? Do you love to work with the latest, coolest, leading- edge technology? Do you want to play a key role in the expansion of our IT infrastructure? If you answered YES, YES, YES then keep reading!

As a member of the IT team, you will contribute to the design, architecture, and end to end deployment in mixed environment of Linux, Unix and Windows with a primary emphasis in applications hosted on Linux. Your duties will cover a large array of tasks from installing/configuring applications like apache on Linux servers to designing automated deployments of custom application and management inside our various labs and data centers. 

Your duties will also include deploying and supporting fundamental datacenter services like LDAP, DNS, NTP, and syslog.  As an escalated point of contact you will utilize exemplary customer service skills to help support lab environments as well as our Data Centers. Your primary role will be to deploy and support the applications in Engineering Labs and Commercial production platforms, which consist of public and private cloud and utilize your advanced Linux skills to bring up new infrastructure and applications to support our ever growing needs across the enterprise.

jobs.title: Software Engineer Rails + Javascript
jobs.content:
At BetterDoctor, we love data in its all forms and shapes.Today, our data and platforms are used by over 7 health plans, 160 companies, 400 developers and 7,000 practices to help people find the care they deserve. We gather, create, import, cluster, aggregate and analyze data each and every day. With our proprietary data pipeline, we build the best products for our consumers to navigate in the vast healthcare vertical. Being a data platform engineer at BetterDoctor is living at the nexus point of technology and US healthcare data.


As we're a small team, every engineer at BetterDoctor is by necessity a generalist. If building a product from the ground up that will be used by millions of people excites you, get in touch.


Sample Projects you might work on:



  • Work with our Product and Architecture teams to take an idea from concept to launch, and to continuous iteration

  • Build a BetterDoctor public API client library for a new platform.

  • Design and implement new features to our distributed Ruby based data pipeline.

  • Re-write core components to optimize for speed.

jobs.title: Backend Python Engineer
jobs.content:
Our San Francisco based Platform Team is focused on growing and engaging TextNow’s user base. This team is extremely data-driven and results oriented. We are seeking talented individuals that operate at the intersection of engineering, analytics, and product strategy. We are aggressively scaling and want candidates that are motivated by growing products and passionate about our mission.


The Platform team has built a Data Pipeline, Warehouse, and Reporting framework from the bottom up using Amazon Web Services, Python, SQL and javascript to drive user analysis initiatives and growth. We are looking for a motivated and experienced individual to lead and manage backend data pipeline engineering and architecture management, implement new open source analytics tools, and optimize performance. You will also work with a team of highly technical Data Scientists to build new NLP tools, and implement new data visualization capabilities.


Some things you’ll do:



  • Work cross-functionally with Product, Growth, Operations to understand business data needs

  • Design, develop, deploy, and manage a reliable and scalable data analysis pipeline, using technologies including: AWS, open-source tooling, and custom-built frameworks.

  • Develop and optimize ETL scripts to move data from unstructured to columnar storage

  • Build QA Automation framework that provides real time alerts on data ingestion, drop rate, data processing and implement systems for tracking data quality and consistency

  • Optimize table schemata based on usage patterns

jobs.title: Web Application Engineer
jobs.content:
Who we are:


At Ecocion, we build web applications to help solve hard problems like environmental compliance, emission tracking and reduction, resource conservation, and environmental impact. We seek people who want to have a direct impact on these challenges. Come help us tackle these issues!


What we're doing:


We're growing our Software Engineering team, so we're on the lookout for sharp, motivated software developers -- from new grads to mid-level -- to help build brand-new versions of our environmental compliance web applications. If you want to make an immediate impact on our major software products, we'd love to talk to you. 


What's in it for you:



  • Employee-managed time off for vacation and sick days. Need time? Take time!

  • Yearly expenses-paid trip to Microsoft Build conference in San Francisco.    

  • 100%-subsidized employee premiums for health and dental; 401k match.

  • Have a blast at our annual company events: volunteering, company picnic, paintball.

  • Join our company sports teams, ping-pong tournaments, running club, Bikes-N-Brews meetups.

  • Celebrate birthdays and work anniversaries at Cake Day, happy hours, and lunch outings.

  • Your choice of touchscreen laptop or desktop with dual external monitors.

jobs.title: C# C Engineer
jobs.content: Software Engineer to develop C#/C++ software for our cutting edge storage and media streaming products in accordance with the modern processes and development philosophy employed by Veracity.

jobs.title: Business Intelligence Analyst
jobs.content:
Meltwater’s Business Intelligence team is making data-driven decisions a reality. We are data advocates - making high quality product, account and customer behavior data easily accessible, to enable our employees to make better decisions and better support our customers.  


We work with:



  • the Product team, to help identify and build metrics that help them identify the next new great feature, and measure whether or not they’ve hit the mark

  • the Customer Success Sales reps, to provide them with data so that they can identify how to better support our customers

  • the Data Science team, to provide them with the data needed to do their data science magic, and solve business problems

  • the Customer Experience team, so that they can better support our customers with in-app chat and self-serve training


Our Business Intelligence Analyst will work with our wide range of stakeholders to identify their requirements, and work with our Agile Engineering teams to implement them.  This is a cross-functional role, where the core of the position centers around analytics, but an understanding of product management, data science and engineering is needed.  


Our Business Intelligence Analyst will also have responsibility for tools and tools integration (Segment, Intercom and Zendesk), contributing directly to business critical missions for growth and self-service solutions.


What might a typical day look like?



  • Start off the day with a meeting with our Social Data Product Owner in Budapest, to discuss the types of social data (Twitter, FaceBook, Instagram, etc) that she’d like to track; work with her to explore how she would use this data to help influence her road map.

  • Follow up with a meeting with Sales, to discuss the types of social data they would like to see, to better understand our customer’s behavior.  Explore how they would use this data to better serve our customers.

  • Begin work on a proposed database design to support the Social Data requirements. Start work on a new user story which will reference the design (for the engineers) and include the SQL (for the Product Owner and Sales) needed to retrieve the data once the feature is built.

  • Noon - turn down a co-worker’s offer to go for a run, and then struggle with the pros and cons of a takeaway salad from Fleur de Sel, a slice at Escape from NY Pizza, or the tomato bisque at Leaf and Ladle.  Settle on pizza, and head back to the office.  Grab a soda from the refrigerator, and sit down next to a Product Manager and a visitor from the Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (our technology incubator, founded by our CEO) in Ghana.

  • After lunch, seek a change of scenery, and settle down on the couches next to the Lego wall; continue working on the Social database design.

  • Mid-afternoon, meet with our Segment Sales Rep.  Discuss the status of our open issues, and get an overview of their roadmap for the coming quarter.  Identify new features that we might be interested in incorporating into our architecture.

  • Close the day by checking in with our Mobile team, to make sure they’re on track with their latest analytics user stories, and answer their questions.

jobs.title: Customer Success Engineer - North or South America
jobs.content:
Platform.sh the award-winning PaaS solution from Paris, France, is looking for a talented customer success engineer who is passionate about assisting customers succeed with cloud technologies. 


Our customer base spans thousands of web applications in > 100 countries consuming 10s of thousands of CPUs on four different public clouds. We were shipping containers before Docker, our sales team can explain the CAP Theorem, and our marketing director programs Haskell. We're hardcore technologists with equally hardcore customers. 


We provide the PaaS layer to the Magento Enterprise Cloud Edition product.


We can clone whole running systems, including the state, services, and topology in a matter seconds, but we want to be able to run that on any developer’s local box. Want to help our customers do that too?


The main API to operate and orchestrate our clusters of LXC containers is Git; our customers need on-boarding and training before they can master the Platform.sh fu. Can you deliver breathtaking and exhilarating tech demos, and explain the intricacies of command line tools?


We need to automate more of the Puppet magic. We need to have more auto-healing on the high-availability clusters. We need more performance out of our multi-protocol ssh proxy. We need work on our CEPH Implementation; We need to get our fabulous Debian package generation streamlined and faster. We need… great ideas on how to make Platform.sh even better, and someone who can help our customers overcome the bumps in the road. Interested? Join us!

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Rally Health improves health and saves money with our friendly, easy-to-use products that help people improve their diet and fitness, shop for health benefits, and find the best doctor at the right price for their needs.


We do it at scale, with millions of reachable accounts and thousands of concurrent users, figures which are roughly doubling every year. The Operations team drives the systems that power this growth in a stable, secure, and performant way, and we are looking for YOU to join our team.


As a DevOps Engineer on the Choice team you will play a pivotal role in making the benefits enrollment portions of our product ready to be used by hundreds of thousands of customers in the fall of 2016 and millions in 2017. Benefits enrollment is something almost everyone does during a short period in the autumn; our traffic is highly episodic and bursty. This makes for an interesting set of operational challenges.


You will work in our Chicago office with a team of 30 software engineers and 15 DevOps engineers, but you will have primary responsibility over your projects aligning with the Choice product. Along with other team members, you will be responsible for 24x7 availability and reliability of our application in an environment where load varies by multiple orders of magnitude week to week.


Primary considerations and where you'll fit in:



  • You will complete our migration from Rackspace to AWS

  • You will maintain our production services and support the development and QA environments

  • Using Terraform and Packer, you will extend the automation of our infrastructure so we can continue to move even faster

  • Based on data from Splunk, New Relic, and other tools you will drive decisions and operational excellence

  • Prior experience at a SaaS company is a must; the ideal candidate will have experience collaborating with git pull requests, building code with Jenkins, and deploying software with Octopus Deploy


The team you will be joining is C#/.NET deploying into a Windows environment, but much of the rest of our firm is JVM/Linux. You will play a key role in determining how to get the best of all these technologies, harmonizing them where possible. If you are an OS bigot, this is not the role for you. We are realistic about the pros and cons of running an internet-facing site on Windows; directionally we wish to migrate to Linux and an ideal candidate will have equal muscle in posh and bash.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Sick of Internet being polluted with popups, ads or clickbait articles? Do you think that most marketing is complete BS? Are you tired of businesses focusing on money instead of people?

Then please keep reading...

*This is why you should work with us:*

- No BS: fight bad marketing and make the web better.
- Create your schedule.
- Choose where you want to work from.
- Work no more than 40 hours a week (you'll be encouraged to focus on what matters).
- Work with businesses who want to change the World.
- There are no secrets in Slices. Everything from our vision, strategy, sales numbers, cashflow, is shared between us.
- We are diverse and want to keep it that way. We welcome people from any background.
- Grow your skills by facing new challenges.
- Slices' success depends on you. Grow with the company by making clients happy, speaking at events, organising conferences, writing books, launching side projects, etc...
- We organise company retreats every few months, so we can all get together and conquer the WoOoOorld.

*About us:*

We were sick and tired of Internet pollution, bad marketing and shareholder capitalism, so we started Slices (founded in 2015 in Dublin, Ireland). 

We are a team of 3 people working remotely.

We help brands to get more conversions and long-term profits with a no-BS, respectful & structured approach to Internet marketing.

Our Good Marketing approach is based on trust and people:
Research: We understand what prevents people to become customers and come back. We also identify new opportunities.
Solutions: We come up wth solutions. We use authentic & respectful digital marketing that speaks to people (not shareholders or competitors).
Test & Evolve: We test everything and never stand still.

*More details:*

Go to this page to view the full job description and apply: https://slicesconsulting.workable.com/jobs/326730

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
We are building a community of top publishing professionals to work with authors. We're also offering a set of powerful collaborative tools for authors to manage their book, contract, files and payment.

You will be working directly with the engineers whole built our system from the ground up. Come build the future of publishing with Reedsy. We're a team of 7 with 5 different nationalities. Come build the future of this industry with us.

**Responsibilities:**

You will join and work on two products: the Reedsy marketplace and our book production tool. Here's what you'll do: 

- Architect and develop highly scalable web applications 
- Work closely with our designers and engineers to design, build, and ship new features from scratch 
- Evaluate and improve the performance, durability, and security of applications in production
- Take ownership for your tasks and see features through from start to finish 
- Help teammates improve when reviewing their work and appreciate feedback when they reciprocate 
- Build RESTful APIs

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content: This position will be responsible for development, maintenance, and support of company and client web sites and mobile applications.  This individual must maintain effective customer (Internal) relationships.  The Front End Developer is expected to be able to analyze, design, code, test, document, and implement projects as part of an agile team.

jobs.title: System Engineer
jobs.content:
As a part of the Engineering team, you will be building scalable solution that millions of users will be using as their primary mobile interface to submit and pay for their orders.  We nurture creativity and encourage individuality to generate a great work environment with personality. In turn, we are seeking talent that doesn’t always want to do it the corporate way but strives to create innovative solutions that amaze and have some fun while doing it. 


Responsibility:



  • Help migrate our data centers to AWS

  • Automate our deployment processes

  • Scale our footprint to be able to handle up to 20 times more traffic next year

  • Innovate with our engineering team to reduce the cost per transaction

  • Work with our team to make our platform more robust

jobs.title: Cloud Native Java Developer
jobs.content:
Railroad19 Inc. is a company that provides software development as a service.


We are currently seeking a Cloud Native Java Developer that is fluent in both Spring Boot and Java 8 to be a technical resource for the development of clean and maintainable code.


At Railroad19, you are part of a company that values your work and gives you the tools you need to succeed. While our headquarters are located in Saratoga Springs, New York, we are a distributed team of remote developers across the US.


Railroad19 provides competitive compensation and excellent benefits.


Core responsibilities:



  • Understand our client's fast-moving business requirements

  • Negotiate appropriate solutions with multiple stake-holders

  • Write and maintain scalable enterprise quality software

  • Build web applications using AngularJS and Spring Boot

  • Build Microservices that connect to Oracle and NoSQL databases

  • Manage the complete software development lifecycle

  • Writing functional and unit tests in order to maintain code quality

  • Work with Jenkins to perform continuous integration

  • Collaborate with other teams in order to deliver a highly performant application that contains little or no defects

  • Identify new opportunities, tools, and services to enhance the custom software platform

  • Support and troubleshoot issues (process & system), identify root cause, and proactively recommend sustainable corrective actions

jobs.title: Sr. Specialist, Drupal Developer
jobs.content:
Society for Science & the Public (SSP) is looking for an energetic and innovative full-time Drupal Developer who is well experienced with selection and use of a wide range of Drupal modules, able to extend existing modules or write new modules from scratch, able to theme using best-practices techniques, and is experiences with tools in LAMP environments.


You will be working with new and emerging technologies for online engagement and support integration with the Drupal CMS.  The ideal candidate will have the ability to self-manage and work quickly, effectively, and efficiently in a team environment with a close attention to detail.  The ideal candidate will have 3+ years full-time Drupal development experience, including module selection, module development and theming using Drupal 7.  This position reports to the Chief Technology Officer.

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Our Infrastructure team is a small but critical part of our organization, responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining Greenhouseâs platform. We craft the environment that enables our product engineers to focus on shipping new features, each of which brings us closer to the goal of delivering the best recruiting software possible.

Weâre working on some interesting problems, and weâre searching for a Senior DevOps Engineer whoâll help keep our site performant and secure by building scalable and fault-tolerant cloud infrastructure. Youâd design and implement features that support our in-house development platform, using technologies like Consul, Docker, Mesos, and Marathon.

In the coming year, you'd help us build out continuous integration and deployment for our applications, support for global scalability and disaster recovery and automated, end-to-end tests on our infrastructure. If youâre looking for a dynamic environment and excited by what weâre looking to do, this may be the job for you.

What you have:
  • A deep understanding of Linux systems
  • Solid programming skills
  • An aim to design and build large, distributed systems
  • A dedication to solve problems and deliver solutions

What tools youâll learn and use:
  • AWS
  • Ansible
  • Consul
  • Docker
  • Mesos and Marathon
  • Ruby and Ruby on Rails
  • Ubuntu Linux

Pay, Perks & Such

At Greenhouse, we take care of our employees and it shows. Greenhouse was proudly named among Crain's New York Business 2015 Best Places to Work in NYC, we were also named as a Best Places to Work by the San Francisco Business Times in 2016! We provide competitive salaries, stock options and a full slate of benefits including health coverage, an FSA, a 401K plan and pre-tax commuter benefits. We invest in our people to ensure that they have everything needed to excel on the job. We pride ourselves on a collaborative culture, including company get-togethers like our monthly CEO "Ask Me Anything" and All Hands meetings. We are a distributed company with offices in New York and San Francisco. Check us out on Glassdoor where we have outstanding reviews by current employees and interviewees alike!

Our philosophy is to empower ourselves and each other to do the best work of our careers. Come join us!

To apply: Please apply at the following link: http://grnh.se/prwmo6

jobs.title: User Interface Designer Web Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for a front-end web developer to join our team and help us serve our continuously growing customer base.  This is a front end development position that requires front-end and user interface design skills.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer C#, MVC
jobs.content:
Reserve Direct is a fast-growing online travel company looking to hire a Senior Web Developer to help us make the leap to a household name.  We are a small team with a start-up mentality.  You will be given the responsibility and allowed the freedom to make an impact in a flat corporate structure with no red tape!



We have a developer-friendly, casual work environment.  We have a great new office space in Kirkwood, MO right next to Grant’s Trail!  Enjoy walks, runs, or bike rides to break-up your day or to start your morning.  



This role will be involved in the development and enhancement of our public facing e-commerce engine, our backend reservation system, and integrations with many of the leading 3rd party travel technology companies (Expedia, Priceline, Sabre).



We want someone who loves technology, loves to code, and wants to be an integral part of the development staff.  We want a curious self-starter, who loves to learn, is attentive to detail and has the will and capacity to work without constant supervision (all hallmarks of a great developer).  We want someone who comes to the table wanting to be great!  You’ll need to dig in, learn our system, and not be afraid to introduce new ideas.  



Reserve Direct offers a competitive salary, 401k with company matching, health insurance, paid vacation, paid holidays, and of course, travel perks (3% of your salary as a travel credit). Hungry for more?!  We have a company-provided, fully stocked fridge and snacks.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
HLK, a full-service digital agency, with offices in St. Louis and Denver, is looking for a Web Developer to join our growing development team. The successful candidate must have an insatiable desire to learn, explore and implement technology solutions for our clients while aligning with the agency's core values: Be Curious, Be Thoughtful, and Be Brave. Areas of Competence and Understanding:



  • Experience developing websites that use content management systems

  • Understands the architecture and design of PHP-based websites

  • Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and an understanding of object oriented programming

  • Ability to work within a collaborative team environment wearing multiple hats

  • Desire to continuously learn new languages, platforms and skills


Qualifications:



  • 3+ years experience programming

  • Has worked with PHP Frameworks (i.e. WordPress, SilverStripe, CakePHP, Laravel, Codelgniter, etc.)

  • Strong communication skills (both in person and in writing)

  • Has experience with modern front-end best practices

  • Has some experience working with REST APIs using AJAX and JSON

  • Has some experience with Agile Methodology


Icing on the Cake:



  • Experience with Grunt, Gulp, MySQL, HTML5, SASS (and/or LESS), Node.js, jQuery, and Adobe Creative Cloud

  • Experience with Java web frameworks and APIs, JSP, and/or Java Content Repository

  • Experience with Apache Sling

  • Experience with SOAP APIs, including XML requests and XSLT for response handling

  • Firm grasp on modern best practices for analytics, SEO, user experience and online marketing strategies

  • Some knowledge of server-side technologies


HLK is a full-service digital agency that creates authentic brand experiences.  Active clients include On The Run, St. Louis Cardinals, Ameren, Monsanto and Webster University.  For more information, visit www.hlkagency.com.

jobs.title: Senior Full-Stack Django/Python Developer for Social Commerce Company
jobs.content:
Our primary vision has been to build tools and resources that help online stores actively engage with their customers using cashback rewards for social media referrals.


We are looking for a senior developer to help build and maintain our core project code base, assist in conceptualizing and implementing new supplemental functionality, and keep the project up-to-date with all current best practices and guidelines for utilized technology stacks.


We pride ourselves on maintaining an open forum during the course of product development; which often leads to experimentation and utilization of new technologies. This requires out-of-the-box creative thinking and an appreciation for the challenges that new technologies bring. We also encourage our team to work creatively and collaboratively on their own ideas that could benefit the concept.


Our ultimate goal is to create a new crowd sourced alternative to traditional algorithmic advertising models, that can truly revolutionize the space while also generating real value for consumers who have invested so much time into their social media presence.
